neighborhood_overview: We have been in Southie the last 8+ years and love the neighborhood and community that has grown around us. You are across the street from Buckley Park and one street from West Broadway with so many restaurants and cafe options.  You are a short walk to The Lawn On D (the popular outdoor park for adults with live music, food trucks, games, and cocktails) and the Convention Center next door. If you continue down D Street you’ll end up in the heart of the Seaport District - lots of fun restaurants and lounging by the waterfront.  There is a corner grocery store- Foodies a couple blocks away and a short Uber ride to Whole Foods on Ink Block.  Walking around West and East Broadway you’ll find a fun variety of boutique shops - Neatly Nested, Luxe-Leisure, Wears + Wares, Stapleton Flower Shop, and Bringing Up Baby. If you continue down East Broadway you will get to Castle Island (about 1.5 miles from condo) and there is a nice beach and running/ biking loop around the ocean.  Being on the We
notes: Cleanliness and comfort is important to us. We only use organic and natural cleaning products in our condo.  Additionally our house cleaner service is top of the line and also uses all natural and kid safe products in our home.
transit: Condo is between D and E off of West Broadway  (1/2 way down Bolton Street - red top and yellow bottom) Street parking is limited to two hours for guests. You can however park on West 1st Street between D and F Street for non-residents with no time limit.  ***During the Spring to Fall months be sure to double check street cleaning days!
access: Will have full access to condo. Closets and drawers in master bedroom are available to guest.  Full kitchen with all your cooking essentials, including organic spices.  Private roof deck.
interaction: Call or text us with any questions:  Andrew (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) Jen (Phone number hidden by Airbnb)
house_rules: Please no shoes or heels in house.
host_about: My wife Jen and I love to travel and enjoy our time in the city to the VT outdoors. We enjoy using Airbnb when we personally travel around the country, so decided to share our space for others to enjoy when we aren't home. We spend our free time hiking, skiing, and hopping around Boston being foodies, catching local concerts, and relaxing on our roof deck!

Brazilian cherry flooring, granite counter tops, stainless steel appliances, gas fireplace and an outdoor patio w a cape cod vibe. This home is truly a one of a kind in South Boston.

house_rules: House Rules Parties are NOT permitted at this property. Having some family in town and need extra space? That’s perfectly fine, we just need to know the situation prior to booking. It helps us cut down on unauthorized activities in our properties. That means that no more than the specified number of guests in your reservation are allowed in the property at any given time. The number of guests indicated in your reservation should be accurate. Children and infants do count towards this total. Please notify us of any changes to the guest count prior to your stay. My name is Shawn and I've enjoyed hosting guests from all over the world since 2012. I'm a news junkie, foodie and love reading. I was born and raised in Orlando, but moved to Boston 6 years ago. I absolutely love Boston and all it has to offer. From the culture, great culinary treats, to the many open spaces and historic sites. My second home is Fort Lauderdale and Vieques, PR. Can you say warm weather! 

I spend most of my day responding and answering guest inquiries and insuring guests have a pleasant stay. Does your Airbnb take up too much of your time? Want to put it on autopilot? Shoot me a message, I would love to help :)

Feel free to reach out with any questions. I try to respond as quickly as time allows and am always available for my guests! 

Happy Booking!

host_about: My passion is cycling. I was born in Lucca, Italy, and received a bicycle racing license when I was 16 years old. Immigrating to America mean't leaving my dream of professional racing behind. However, I continued to do century rides in the United States until the present time. My wife, Sandy, has a Ph.D. from the School of Medicine at Boston University and  is, currently,  doing neuroscience research. She lives much of her day in the world of ideas, while I continue to be focused on action. It works well and we are excited about our new Airbnb adventure!

name: Spacious 1BR w/Full Bath on Dorchester Heights
summary: Our home is on Dorchester Heights. You’ll enjoy your stay because of the historical significance of the site, the easy five minute walk to both the beach and local restaurants, and the 10 minute ride from downtown Boston and Logan Airport.  The guest room has its own entrance and encompasses the ground floor of our home.
space: Your living space is separate from the remainder of our home.  You can enter and exit directly from your space.  The entrance is at ground level and is two steps down into the entryway which leads straight to the bedroom and bathroom.  The bathroom contains a standard wash sink and toilet, a shower, a washer and dryer.  If you need an iron or hairdryer, just ask.  You have a space heater and fan to adjust the temperature as desired.
description: Our home is on Dorchester Heights. You’ll enjoy your stay because of the historical significance of the site, the easy five minute walk to both the beach and local restaurants, and the 10 minute ride from downtown Boston and Logan Airport.  The guest room has its own entrance and encompasses the ground floor of our home. Your living space is separate from the remainder of our home.  You can enter and exit directly from your space.  The entrance is at ground level and is two steps down into the entryway which leads straight to the bedroom and bathroom.  The bathroom contains a standard wash sink and toilet, a shower, a washer and dryer.  If you need an iron or hairdryer, just ask.  You have a space heater and fan to adjust the temperature as desired. There is no upstairs access. We are always available to assist you with your needs and answer any questions that you may have. Dorchester Heights is most significant today for the views of the city and harbor islands.  The homes in the area
neighborhood_overview: Dorchester Heights is most significant today for the views of the city and harbor islands.  The homes in the area are well kept and date back to the mid to late 1800's.  It is located in the center of South Boston and comprises the heights from which the American colonists under the command of General George Washington forced the evacuation of the occupying British forces from Boston on March 17, 1776.  This was the first victory for the Americans during the Revolutionary War.  The neighborhood is vibrant with many restaurants and pubs nearby. We are within walking distance of South Boston beaches.  The Boston Convention and Exhibition Center (BCEC) and Seaport District is one mile away.
notes: 1) Make sure to duck as you enter and leave the unit.  The entrance doorway is not a standard height! 2) There is only one bed.  A party of three must include a child.  There is a cot available for the child. 3) The space is recently remodeled.  Please leave your shoes at the door. 4)  Any guests must be pre-approved and will incur an additional fee of $50 per night.
transit: Public transportation is very accessible from Dorchester Heights.  Bus stops for the MBTA are only two blocks away which go to either downtown or Back Bay.  The nearest MBTA stations are Broadway and Andrew - both on the Red Line. There is also a taxi stand by the bus stop.  Of course, Uber and Lyft are also available.  Parking on the street is available to guests during the day.  Between 6PM and 10AM, on street parking is restricted to South Boston residents. name: Cozy Room in the Middle of South Boston
summary: South Boston is a fantastic neighborhood with tons of bars, restaurants, and more! Our apartment is a few blocks from W Broadway (the main street of South Boston) where you can find popular bars like Lincoln and Capo, cool coffee houses like Caffé Nero, and a candle pin bowling alley! We are also a five minute walk from the beach and Red Line/Andrew Square T stop, where you can easily get into downtown in less than 15 minutes, and a short walk from both the Seaport and South End neighborhoods.
space: We (my girlfriend and I) love to travel and almost exclusively use AirBnB as our housing choice. We have tried to incorporate all of the things we love about staying in others’ apartments into our place for you! Please feel free to ask for any recommendations for things to do, eat, or drink around the city, as we love showing people around and helping people experience new places like a local! About our place: Our room is spacious and contains a comfortable queen bed with a memory foam topper and plush sheets. The room also has a full size mirror for getting ready. The closet is not usable, as we use it for storage, but we have drawers available for storing clothes as well as a wall mounted rack for your hanging needs. The TV in the room has a Chromecast for relaxing and catching up on any Netflix shows you like. Also available is our roof deck with breathtaking city views that has a table and chairs as well as a gas grill. Our couches are both very comfortable for lounging after a lon

neighborhood_overview: South Boston is one of the hottest neighborhoods in Boston as of late given its proximity to the Seaport area with restaurants, bars and a bustling nightlife. We are also conveniently located near the convention center (BCEC) and downtown (Financial District, Faneuil Hall/Quincy Market) along with subway access on the redline (Andrew Square T stop is 0.2 miles away - 4 minute walk down the street) and frequent bus routes to Downtown Boston/Copley Square. The home is located on a private, quiet street off a main street in South Boston down the block from the Andrew Square T stop (subway). It is mostly a quiet neighborhood and the majority of locals are twentysomethings/early thirtysomethings as well as local South Boston residents. There is more activity on the weekends but this is mainly a residential area with the bars/nightlife about 1/4 mile - 1 mile away. Places range from 5-star (Del Frisco's, Morton's Steakhouse) to sports bars (Remy's) and lounges (Lucky's). You can grocery shop
notes: Reminder - no parties allowed and the only people allowed in the unit are those on the reservation. Parking: There isn't on-site parking, however there is street parking near the house that varies for visitors. The only restriction is resident parking on most streets only on Monday through Thursday from 6 p.m.-10 a.m., you can park anywhere for any timeframe on the weekends. If you need to park during the week, there is an unrestricted main street (Old Colony Avenue) for all visitors that is 2 blocks from the house that you can park any time. Take note of the signs for street cleaning (April-November) and any restricted areas to avoid towing. If you would like to park in a lot or garage, there are several options about 1/2 mile from the house. Most people opt for the free street parking but I'm happy to help guide you for whatever suits your needs. Other essentials: Full linens (sheets/pillows, etc.) and towels are provided and all beds/pillows are protected with anti-bacterial/waterpr

access: You will have access to the entire space and will be there alone, this space won't be shared with myself or anyone else while you are renting. interaction: I live a couple blocks away and I'm available if you need anything at all.  The apartment is professionally managed with support 24/7/365 in the event any issues arise.

Additionally, you can lock the screen doors when home as well for additional safety. Please treat the home as your own and be careful with the appliances, flooring and furniture.  If you run into an issue with anything, please call/text me immediately to address. summary: Private bedroom available in new, third story condo in safe South Boston neighborhood. A quick walk to multiple nightlife options on W. Broadway and a short walk to the beach. Nestled up to Telegraph Hill, you’ll enjoy an open floor plan with and natural sunlight beaming through the living room and kitchen. Plenty of authentic coffee shops, parks, bars, and restaurants nearby. Includes your own private bedroom/bathroom complete with 'Jack and Jill' closets and sinks.
space: Private deck off the master bedroom has an table and an easy-to-use gas grill for private outdoor dining. Full kitchen includes cooking utensils and fridge access in case you like to cook. Flat screen TVs mounted in the living room and master bedroom.

neighborhood_overview: Within walking distance you'll find historic Telegraph Hill, Thomas Park, and the Dorchester Heights Monument. In 1898, the General Court of Massachusetts commissioned a monument to stand atop Dorchester Heights. The white marble tower commemorates the 1776 victory in which US rebel forces and local volunteers stealthily fortified the summit of Dorchester Heights with over 59+ cannons to prevent the British militia from advancing.
notes: NA
transit: In terms of public transportation, there are multiple bus stops around South Boston will get you wherever you need to go. South Boston is also filled with Lyft and Uber drivers on call 24/7, always available within 5 to 10 minutes.
access: There's a lock-box available 24/7 outside attached to the gate on the side of the condo.
interaction: Myself or Kayla can provide you with a wide variety of dining or nightlife recommendations nearby.

host_about: Born in 1985, originally from St. Louis, moved to Boston in 2013 and love it here. My two favorite cities (besides Boston and St. Louis) are Auckland, New Zealand and Chicago. I enjoy hockey, sailing, and a good Manhattan.

name: Double Unit - Downtown/Convention/Ocean/Tour 287BC
summary: Renovated - 2 unit combo - total of 6 bedrooms (16 total beds), 2 bath, 2000sqft, Beds: 4 Queen, 10 Twin, 2 Full sofa bed. The 2 units are separated by a common bldg flight of stairs. 5 min drive to Downtown or Airport, 5 min walk to the Beach/Ocean, 10 min walk to the Redline Subway T station. The location is great because you've got the City, Nature, and Transportation. 2nd floor unit - no elevator. Approx $10 Uber ride to Boston Convention Center (BCEC). No dedicated parking, limited options.
space: ACTUAL GUEST REVIEW JULY 2017: “These guys are well prepared. Very smooth, access with codes, the place was impeccable, and the SHOWER head... oooooohhh that shower head... AWESOME! Also, the mattresses are VERY VERY COMFORTABLE ... even the bunker ones; you'll get a good rest, promised. And... right next door... a pub! silent, you won't notice any noise from the apartment, but, how convenient. Will definitely go back there. ”  NEW UPDATE: We now have a full body MASSAGE chair in the unit that is perfect after a day of work or visiting tourist destinations! TWO UNITS - 2 entire 3 bedroom, 1 bathroom apartments to your very own, approximately 1000sqft EACH. So in Total, it's 6 bedrooms, with 3 Queen beds, 10 Twin beds, 2 Sofa beds. These two units are NOT directly connected, but are only separated by a single common stairwell in the building - so you have to go out of one unit, into a building area, then into the other unit. Each unit has an open concept living room, dining, and kitchen

neighborhood_overview: NEIGHBORHOOD: It's walking distance (10 mins) from 3 red-line subways (Andrews Square, Broadway, JFK) that will take you to downtown Boston and Cambridge, and you're also walking distance to Carson Beach (10 mins) where there is beach volleyball in the summer. There are a couple of great restaurants nearby, including one next door down the street from Telegraph Hill (called Telegraph Hill), and closer to the center of South Boston, there are a number of well regarded fine dining restaurants and bars – just 5-8 blocks away. Approx $10 Uber ride to the Boston Convention Center (BCEC), or approx 30 minute walk. DISTANCE TO POPULAR DESTINATIONS: 1. The Boston airport is 5.0 miles away and that's a 10 minute drive in normal traffic. You can also take the subway (blue or silver line, then to red line). 2. The BCEC (Boston Convention & Exhibition Center) is 1.4 miles away or a 32 minute walk or 5 minute drive.  3. The closest subway ("T") stop is at Andrew Square (red line) 0.3 miles away or
notes: TO HELP US ENSURE YOU HAVE A QUIET, PEACEFUL, AND ENJOYABLE TIME WHILE STAYING WITH US, WE WOULD LIKE YOU TO KNOW THE FOLLOWING APPLIES FOR ALL GUESTS WE HOST: 1. We ask you to remove your shoes while inside the units. Boston homes are full of charm, but are also some of the oldest in the country and thus the walls and floors are thin – and sound travels. Removing your shoes helps to both protect our floors, but also ensures the people below you also quietly enjoy their stay. 2. No loud noises before 9am and after 10pm. As noted above, sound travels. Our unit has a device by Netatmo, called the Home Health Coach, and it measures air quality/pollution, humidity, temperature, and noise levels – and amongst other things, alerts us when noise levels get too high. Sounds are NOT recorded though. 3. For your safety, we also have a Leeo which monitors for the smoke alarm and carbon monoxide alarms and notifies us if they sound off, so as to keep you safe. We get notified if an alarm goes off
transit: It's walking distance (10 mins) from 2 red-line subways that will take you to downtown Boston and Cambridge. There is also a bus stop right out front. See the HOUSE MANUAL for parking tips. There is also Uber that can pickup/dropoff for inexpensive to downtown Boston. Approx $10 Uber ride to the Boston Convention Center (BCEC), or approx 30 minute walk.
access: EACH OF TWO UNITS: The entire unit (kitchen, bathroom, living room, both bedrooms), and common coin-op laundry. Parking is on available the street (visitors OK) - see note on parking. Keyless entry system. As your arrival date nears, 1 day prior, you will be sent a message with instructions for electronic keycode access that are personalized for your stay. Check in time is 3pm, and check out time is 11am - that gives us a 4 hour window to have our cleaning crew fully clean, disinfect, change sheets, for your arrival and the guest coming in after you. You can check in anytime thereafter. Please note that this also means that the 11am check out must be strictly adhered to on your last day, as we may have another guest checking in that afternoon, and need time for our cleaning people to do the same. Unlike a hotel that has multiple rooms to shuffle around, we have limited units to shuffle around.
interaction: EACH is a fully contained private apartment (except for the common staircase between the two units) so there is no need for direct interaction with guests, though we do like to meet you and you will see us around the building doing maintenance, etc.. You may call/text/email through here anytime as well. Before you arrive and after you leave, our cleaning crew will come in to clean and disinfect everything, replace all the sheets with newly clean ones. Please remember that check in time is 3pm and check out is 11am - this is important because we often have guests check in/out on the same days, back-to-back.
house_rules: PLEASE close the front lobby door behind you after you enter and when you leave each time. It's a new door and it doesn't always latch on its own. PLEASE remove your shoes inside, and no smoking inside or nearby outside (because it drifts in) please. NO parties or loud music at any time, no smoking period - and definitely no loud noises before 9am or after 10pm, in consideration for our neighbors above, below, and to each side of the unit. The existence of Airbnb depends upon the kind consideration of our neighbors - please help us keep up good community relations. In an effort to help ensure you have quiet and peaceful enjoyment during your stay, we have surveillance video cameras in all the common areas of the building (which also detect loud audio) - of course, none inside the units. Boston buildings tend to be old classic structures, but with thin walls, so noise travels very easily. Breaking these rules forfeits your stay (you will be asked to immediately leave) and your deposit a
host_about: I grew up in Colorado, moved to Cambridge to attend MIT, moved away to London and various places, now back in Boston for the past 20 years. My husband, Sean is a retired US Army veteran and graduate of the US Military Academy (West Point) - and we love to host. We also like to travel and we host as we would want to be hosted when we travel - we like comfort and convenience. Come visit, play some volleyball at the nearby beach - or just head downtown - we can walk there too!

name: Amazing apartment in the heart of South Boston
summary: An amazing apartment in South Boston. Includes one bedroom and a living room, kitchen and bathroom.  Quick access to parks, restaurants, bars, waterfront and public transportation. 10 min drive to the airport. Very close to seaport, Chinatown, Back Bay, South End. Ideal for 1-2 people however a 3rd person can sleep on the couch.
space: The apartment is renovated and is very clean. The fireplace in the living room will keep you warm during the cold days in Boston :-)
description: An amazing apartment in South Boston. Includes one bedroom and a living room, kitchen and bathroom.  Quick access to parks, restaurants, bars, waterfront and public transportation. 10 min drive to the airport. Very close to seaport, Chinatown, Back Bay, South End. Ideal for 1-2 people however a 3rd person can sleep on the couch. The apartment is renovated and is very clean. The fireplace in the living room will keep you warm during the cold days in Boston :-) The entire apartment is yours for the whole stay. See & Do A year-round wonder, South Boston's Castle Island is one amazing waterfront park. Paved paths for walking, running biking, or blading loop along the water's edge. Take a break to watch the planes arrive and depart from Logan's runways which seem to be mere "steps" across the bay. Large lots allow people to park and enjoy the view from the comfort of their cars (perfect when the temperatures reach winter lows).  Summer at this Southie park, invites swimmers to dip into the
neighborhood_overview: See & Do A year-round wonder, South Boston's Castle Island is one amazing waterfront park. Paved paths for walking, running biking, or blading loop along the water's edge. Take a break to watch the planes arrive and depart from Logan's runways which seem to be mere "steps" across the bay. Large lots allow people to park and enjoy the view from the comfort of their cars (perfect when the temperatures reach winter lows).  Summer at this Southie park, invites swimmers to dip into the water at one of the beaches that line South Boston. The M Street Beach has gained notoriety as of late due to an influx of singles frolicking on the shore. When all that wondering has left you a little pooped, plop yourself on a bench outside of Sullivan's (Sully's to the locals) for a snack.  Eat Dive into a big plate of diner classics at Mul's. This West Broadway eatery serves some sensational (simple) breakfast food. Surly waitstaff and classic dishes combine to make this a memorable meal where you are sur
notes: NA
transit: There are buses 1 minute walk from the apartment. To get to the T/subway you can either take a bus or walk ~15 minutes. Or you can use Uber/Lyft. The "Uber pool" option makes it VERY cheap to move around.
access: The entire apartment is yours for the whole stay.

name: Spacious Condo with Patio near BCEC!
summary: Come stay at our large condo in the middle of South Boston with rare private outdoor space!  Our home offers two floors of living space. Upstairs you will find the open-concept living room and kitchen, a full bathroom with a jetted tub, and a bedroom with a queen bed.  Downstairs is the master suite with a king bed and its own bathroom. Also on the bottom floor are a den with a double futon, a small open office area, and laundry. The upstairs leads out to the porch and back yard. Pet friendly!
space: Our condo has 3 bedrooms on 2 floors of living space along with a private outdoor porch and patio space. We love to have a coffee on the porch in the morning when it’s warm! Staying with us in the summer? You might be able to pick some fresh raspberries or tomatoes from our garden!
description: Come stay at our large condo in the middle of South Boston with rare private outdoor space!  Our home offers two floors of living space. Upstairs you will find the open-concept living room and kitchen, a full bathroom with a jetted tub, and a bedroom with a queen bed.  Downstairs is the master suite with a king bed and its own bathroom. Also on the bottom floor are a den with a double futon, a small open office area, and laundry. The upstairs leads out to the porch and back yard. Pet friendly! Our condo has 3 bedrooms on 2 floors of living space along with a private outdoor porch and patio space. We love to have a coffee on the porch in the morning when it’s warm! Staying with us in the summer? You might be able to pick some fresh raspberries or tomatoes from our garden! Guests can access the entire condo, including the 3 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, living room and kitchen, porch, and patio. We are always available using the app, and we will leave our cell phone numbers. Southie is a great
neighborhood_overview: Southie is a great neighborhood with new restaurants and shops but a residential feel! There are multiple great restaurants within 5 minutes walking from our house, including Loco Taqueria (for Mexican and great margs!), Lincoln Tavern (delicious modern American), and Capo (Italian). Broadway St is full of local businesses, including shops, salons, and cafes.
notes: Uber and public transportation are very easy to use in the city, so we encourage guests to leave their cars at home! If you do bring one, we don’t have a private parking space, but street parking is very easy to find on weekends. If coming during the week, we recommend using a parking garage. Feel free to message to chat about options! We do have a baby gate that we can put at the top of the stairs. Just let us know!
transit: Southie is a short Uber or bus ride from downtown Boston, Back Bay, the South End, the North End, and all the tourist sites! We are also 21 minutes walking or 7 minutes driving from the BCEC.  The #11 bus, right outside the door, can take you directly to Downtown Crossing via Broadway station (the entry to Southie with many restaurants) and our delicious Chinatown. The #9 bus, which is a 4 minute walk away, can take you to Copley Square in Back Bay, which is an awesome area with restaurants, a huge mall, and Newbury St for shopping.
access: Guests can access the entire condo, including the 3 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, living room and kitchen, porch, and patio.
interaction: We are always available using the app, and we will leave our cell phone numbers.
house_rules: All guests should be respectful of the fact that we live in a close neighborhood and noise will disrupt the neighbors, including the upstairs neighbor. No loud parties are allowed. Pets are subject to approval. Guests must disclose any pets that they are bringing.
host_about: Hi! We are Kate and Fernando, originally from Tennessee and Argentina, but now enthusiastic Boston residents! We love how small and tight-knit Boston is, while at the same time being an important city full of history. We know you'll love our place!

name: Trendy Neighborhood Southie Pad| Studio 1BR 1BA #7
summary: The kitchen is fully-equipped with appliances, including refrigerator, range with oven, microwave, pots/pans and cooking utensils. There is a 32” flat screen TV with local channels located in the living room. This unit has a desk with seating for two that can also be used as a dining table. The bedroom has a full size bed, dresser and plenty of closet space with additional storage above. There is hard wood flooring through-out the unit and high ceilings as well.
space: .The unit gets great light and overlooks East Broadway Street. Most of our units are designed to be interchangeable and each unit has at least one "like-kind" unit within the same building that is similar in size and identical in amenities as well as sleeping capacity. In most cases the unit you have reserved is the unit you will be staying in, however, we reserve the right to put you in a like-kind unit for the term of your rental. If you are given a like-kind unit it is guaranteed to be in the same building and no more than one floor above the unit you have reserved (this only applies to buildings without elevators). If your unit is going to be changed to a like-kind unit you will be notified at least 24 hours in advance.

Each unit has an open concept living room, dining, and kitchen - this means you get 2 living rooms, 2 dining areas, 2 kitchens, 2 bathrooms. 1st floor and lower
description: Renovated - 2 unit combo - total of 3 bedrooms (7 total beds), 2 bath, 1500sqft, Beds: 3 Queen, 2 Full sofa beds, 1 Queen air mattress, 1 Twin loveseat bed. The 2 units are separated by an interior stairwell. 5 min drive to Downtown or Airport, 5 min walk to the Beach/Ocean, 10 min walk to the Redline Subway T station. The location is great because you've got the City, Nature, and Transportation. No dedicated parking. ACTUAL GUEST REVIEW JULY 2017: “These guys are well prepared. Very smooth, access with codes, the place was impeccable, and the SHOWER head... oooooohhh that shower head... AWESOME! neighborhood_overview: NEIGHBORHOOD: It's walking distance (10 mins) from 3 red-line subways (Andrews Square, Broadway, JFK) that will take you to downtown Boston and Cambridge, and you're also walking distance to Carson Beach (10 mins) where there is beach volleyball in the summer. There are a couple of great restaurants nearby, including one next door down the street from Telegraph Hill (called Telegraph Hill), and closer to the center of South Boston, there are a number of well regarded fine dining restaurants and bars – just 5-8 blocks away. Approx $10 Uber ride to the Boston Convention Center (BCEC), or approx 30 minute walk. DISTANCE TO POPULAR DESTINATIONS: 1. The Boston airport is 5.0 miles away and that's a 10 minute drive in normal traffic. You can also take the subway (blue or silver line, then to red line). 2. The BCEC (Boston Convention & Exhibition Center) is 1.4 miles away or a 32 minute walk or 5 minute drive.  3. The closest subway ("T") stop is at Andrew Square (red line) 0.3 miles away or
notes: TO HELP US ENSURE YOU HAVE A QUIET, PEACEFUL, AND ENJOYABLE TIME WHILE STAYING WITH US, WE WOULD LIKE YOU TO KNOW THE FOLLOWING APPLIES FOR ALL GUESTS WE HOST: 1. We ask you to remove your shoes while inside the units. Boston homes are full of charm, but are also some of the oldest in the country and thus the walls and floors are thin – and sound travels. Removing your shoes helps to both protect our floors, but also ensures the people below you also quietly enjoy their stay. 2. No loud noises before 9am and after 10pm. As noted above, sound travels. Our unit has a device by Netatmo, called the Home Health Coach, and it measures air quality/pollution, humidity, temperature, and noise levels – and amongst other things, alerts us when noise levels get too high. Sounds are NOT recorded though. 3. For your safety, we also have a Leeo which monitors for the smoke alarm and carbon monoxide alarms and notifies us if they sound off, so as to keep you safe. We get notified if an alarm goes off
transit: It's walking distance (10 mins) from 2 red-line subways that will take you to downtown Boston and Cambridge. There is also a bus stop right out front. See the HOUSE MANUAL for parking tips. There is also Uber that can pickup/dropoff for inexpensive to downtown Boston. Approx $10 Uber ride to the Boston Convention Center (BCEC), or approx 30 minute walk.
access: EACH OF TWO UNITS: The entire unit (kitchen, bathroom, living room, both bedrooms), and common coin-op laundry. Parking is on available the street (visitors OK) - see note on parking. Keyless entry system. As your arrival date nears, 1 day prior, you will be sent a message with instructions for electronic keycode access that are personalized for your stay. Check in time is 3pm, and check out time is 11am - that gives us a 4 hour window to have our cleaning crew fully clean, disinfect, change sheets, for your arrival and the guest coming in after you. You can check in anytime thereafter. Please note that this also means that the 11am check out must be strictly adhered to on your last day, as we may have another guest checking in that afternoon, and need time for our cleaning people to do the same. Unlike a hotel that has multiple rooms to shuffle around, we have limited units to shuffle around.
interaction: This duplex are 2 fully contained private apartments with a connecting staircase, so there is no need for direct interaction with guests, though we do like to meet you and you will see us around the building doing maintenance, etc.. You may call/text/email through here anytime as well. Before you arrive and after you leave, our cleaning crew will come in to clean and disinfect everything, replace all the sheets with newly clean ones. Please remember that check in time is 3pm and check out is 11am - this is important because we often have guests check in/out on the same days, back-to-back.
house_rules: PLEASE close the front lobby door behind you after you enter and when you leave each time. It's a new door and it doesn't always latch on its own. PLEASE remove your shoes inside, and no smoking inside or nearby outside (because it drifts in) please. NO parties or loud music at any time, no smoking period - and definitely no loud noises before 9am or after 10pm, in consideration for our neighbors above, below, and to each side of the unit. The existence of Airbnb depends upon the kind consideration of our neighbors - please help us keep up good community relations. In an effort to help ensure you have quiet and peaceful enjoyment during your stay, we have surveillance video cameras in all the common areas of the building (which also detect loud audio) - of course, none inside the units. Boston buildings tend to be old classic structures, but with thin walls, so noise travels very easily. Breaking these rules forfeits your stay (you will be asked to immediately leave) and your deposit a
host_about: I grew up in Colorado, moved to Cambridge to attend MIT, moved away to London and various places, now back in Boston for the past 20 years. My husband, Sean is a retired US Army veteran and graduate of the US Military Academy (West Point) - and we love to host. We also like to travel and we host as we would want to be hosted when we travel - we like comfort and convenience. Come visit, play some volleyball at the nearby beach - or just head downtown - we can walk there too!

Enjoy two decks and jaw-dropping skyline roof deck for memorable entertaining!
space: My place is a 3-bedroom and 2.5-bathroom single family house located in the heart of South Boston. There are also **TWO PARKING** spots, one garage parking and another off-street parking. Only 8-minute walk from the Broadway T station, you don't even need a car when you stay in Boston. It is just minutes away from Downtown and Seaport area if you prefer to drive. There is direct access to garage parking and tandem outdoor parking space for your convenience.  With private decks on both second and third floors, as well as a fabulous city view roof deck, you can enjoy the sunlight of Boston. Steam shower and bathtub are also available in the master bathroom.  On the second floor, you can access an enormous deck with perfect set-ups for sunny days. name: 3Bd/3Bath So. Boston 1mile to BCEC/seaport
summary: You will Love my spacious 3 bedroom 3 full bathroom  with outdoor space, located in South Boston! Easy walking or quick drive to downtown Boston, Seaport District, Convention Center (BCEC), Airport, Train, Bus Stops, Subway Stations and numerous entertainment/eating venues that Boston has to offer!  Located in a safe neighborhood by wonderful parks and beach.  The condo has 2 floors of privacy.  My place is good for couples, business travelers, families, and big groups.
space: This home has hardwood floors throughout, new appliances, lighting, living and dining space  and more. The main area offers open-concept living and kitchen area with granite counters and bar seating. The home also has central heating and air conditioning as well as a gas fireplace (just turn on a light switch for warmth and ambiance). The home is equipped with high-speed wireless internet and Comcast/Xfinity digital TV. The home provides 3 bedrooms with 3 full bathroom (2 tiled shower and 1 bathtub). All linens, towels and basic toiletries are provided. 2 bedrooms include queen sized mattresses and 1 bedroom has 1 king size mattress and there is a closet and dressers available to you for your belongings in each of the bedrooms.  Each bathroom is stocked with towels, toiletries and amenities for your use (shampoo, soap, etc.) Also, keep in mind Boston hotel taxes are 14.45% when considering your options, for a $600 stay that is an additional $87 (you don't pay any taxes for this booking

neighborhood_overview: South Boston is one of the hottest neighborhoods in Boston as of late given its proximity to the Seaport area with restaurants, bars and a bustling nightlife. We are also conveniently located near the convention center (BCEC, 1 mile away) and downtown (Financial District, Faneuil Hall/Quincy Market) along with subway access on the Red Line (Broadway T stop) and frequent bus routes to Downtown Boston/Copley Square. The home is located on the east side South Boston. It is mostly a quiet neighborhood and the majority of locals are twenty somethings /early thirty somethings as well as local South Boston residents. There is more activity on the weekends but this is mainly a residential area with the bars/nightlife a few blocks away. Places range from 5-star (Del Frisco's, Morton's Steakhouse) to sports bars (Remy's), casual dining and dive bars.  I'm happy to offer recommendations.  You can grocery shop at Stop and Shop (a few blocks away) Foodies market (1.1 miles away) with many organic o
notes: Parking: There isn't on-site parking, however there is street parking near the house that varies for visitors. The only restriction is resident parking on most streets every night from 6 p.m.-10 a.m.  If you need to park during the week, there is some visitor parking on the main street (Broadway).  It is usually 2 hour parking, but after 6PM, it is not enforced overnight (just read the signs).  Also, take note of the signs for street cleaning (April 1-November 30) and any restricted areas to avoid towing. If you would like to park in a lot or garage, there are several options about 1/2 -1 mile from the house. Given our proximity to public transit and readily available Uber, you may want to consider going without a car.  There are also Zipcar locations in the neighborhood if you're a member.  Boston is a very walkable city as well.   I'm happy to help guide you for whatever suits your needs. You can also look at parking in the two municipal parking lots located in South Boston – City of
transit: We are close to many hot locations in Boston: Subway stop - Redline T at Broadway: 1.5 mi Local Buses (5, 7, 9, 10, and 11): 0.2 mi (3 blocks away) BCEC (Convention Center): 1.3 mi - under a 5 minute cab/uber ride  Waterfront/Seaport Area: 1.4 mi Laugh Boston (Comedy Club): 1.3 mi Beach/Castle Island (M street Beach): 0.4 mi M street Park 0.2 mi Stop and shop .25 mi /4 blocks away Foodie's Urban Market: 1.1 mi Starbucks: 0.3 mi Dunkin Donuts: 0.3 mi Children’s Museum 1.8 mi South Station (subway, Amtrak) 2.0 mi Logan airport 10 minute drive
access: You will have access to the entire space and will be there alone, this space won't be shared with myself or anyone else while you are renting. You are able to use the home as your own, feel free to use the kitchen and any supplies, watch movies and enjoy the home.
interaction: My friends live on the 2nd floor, and I live on the 3rd floor, but each floor is a separate unit.  I'll keep to myself unless you need anything at all!
house_rules: - No smoking on the premises, Please respect the neighbors. Lock doors/windows at all times: While the area is safe, it is still an urban environment and doors/windows need to be locked at all times. Please treat the home as your own and be careful with the appliances, flooring and furniture. If you run into an issue with anything, please call/text me immediately to address. Rental agreement - Per my insurance policy requirements, by making a reservation and ultimately booking the home, you are agreeing to the following: 1. You're responsible for ensuring that the accommodation is left in the condition it was in upon check-in. 2. You shall be liable for any damages caused by your own acts and omissions (including without limitation failure to timely vacate the accommodation) and also for the acts and omissions of any individuals that you invite or otherwise allow into the accommodation. Guests can cancel within 24 hours of booking and receive a full refund, or cancel anytime up to seven days before the start of your trip and receive a 50% refund. Trips cancelled fewer than seven days in advance are not eligible for refunds. If you cancel within 24 hours of booking, please reach out to our team, as this refund has to be processed manually.   3. Check-in time is any time after 4 pm. Check-out time is any time before 11 am. You're welcome to request an early check in or late checkout, but this is not guaranteed and we can only confirm 24 hours in advance. 4. We do not allow smoking of any kind, including but not limited to nicotine, tobacco derived products and/or cannabis derived substances; breaking this rule will incur a $300 fine. 5. Most of our locations do not allow pets. 6. Generally, parties or excessive noise are not allowed in our locations. I

description: Located just minute from downtown, in the heart of Boston's vibrant, historic south neighborhood. Our totally brand new, fully-furnished 3bedrooms, 2.5 bathroom. Our duplex house offer a comfort and convenient alternative to hotel stay during your next visit to Boston. Guests are welcome to use the brand new washer and dryer and brand new open kitchen, and kitchen bar.. Staying spacious living room , enjoying high speed internet , flat screen smart HD TV. Our home is almost 2000sq, two porches and one roof deck. near Andrew T station 2 minutes for walking. our brand new home is balanced blend of timeless decor and contemporary convenience, The two-stories feature a spacious open-concept living area, three bed rooms, 2.5 bath with space to accommodate up to 8 guests comfortably. all bedrooms include memory foam mattresses, top-of-the-line linens, piles of plush pillows, and ample storage space. Two bedrooms feature queen-sized beds and one features two full-sized beds. The brand new bat
neighborhood_overview: Our neighbors are almost are people who work in Boston, high class people.  Almost all new condos are on our street, nice , clean and quiet.
notes: Our place is good for couples, business, travelers and families. Just a stone throw to the Andrew square Redline subway stop.(2 stops from downtown) Across the street  from public tennis courts.a short walk from a major park(5minutes) and the beach( 10 minutes). Kitchen w/ stone counters, beautiful brazilian hardwood flooring, the living room window with fashion shade,  central AC, back porch and roof deck.  we have open kitchen for the people cook, and open bar for drink. Brand new in unit Laundry washer and dryer for your all stay use. you don't need key to open the door, just enter password. On the street parking. you can stay outside porch or our roof deck to get sunshine and fresh air. Master bedroom with full bath. tons of closet space.
transit: Andrew T station 2 minutes for walking,  Via the subway you can be at the following locations in a matter of minutes south station-- 5 minutes boston common-6 minutes downtown crossing---7 minutes Mass General hospital---9 minutes MIT---13 minutes Harvard---15 minutes Tufts---17 minutes BCEC---2 miles ( by uber $6 ) Castle island---walking 10 minutes Revolutionary War Fort on one end of castle island beach, the Kennedy Presidential library on the other end of sandy beach public tennis and basketball play courts are 10 meters away Bar, Restaurants and groceries are a 1-2 minutes walk in all directions BIG BOX is 10 minutes walk(2 minutes drive)due west in South Bay shopping center----Starbucks, Target, BestBuy, Marshall's, TJMax, BED BATH& BEYOND, Home depot, Office Max, Stop &shop Star market---5 minutes drive Southeast Asian restaurant---10 minutes drive due south on Dorchester Ave On street parking. Zipcar and Subway are located across the street. Uber is always an option. This home
access: Hi, Every clients,       I offer murphy bed for the clients who are over 8 persons, if not, you can not use murphy bed.      clients can park your cars on the old colony ave, you just walk there in a few minutes. you park your cars better before 9pm, thanks!       From 93 south Exit #16 drive in , across the bridge just one minute to arrive at our house, passing T station Andrew square.
interaction: NA
house_rules: House manual 1. After 11 pm, No party, don't have loud TV sound, don't make loud noise    ( this includes after you return from the bar). 2. Please keep the front two doors closed to prevent noise traveling      downstairs. 3. Downstairs neighbor Rohan has right to  stop any violations to this Manual,      if he has to come up for a noise complaint after hours then you will be      charged a $300 penalty or more (depend on the situation). We hope every      client obey them!          - pet charge $20/nightly   Thanks!
host_about: i am a gentle man, i love my family. i work hard, i love reading and traveling, sometimes i like cooking asian food or playing Chinese game with my friends, i will do my best for every client, let you feel it is your home, welcome my friends.

house_rules: House Rules 1. All bookings require a security deposit of $300 or more. You will not be charged for this in advance. 2. Guests can cancel within 24 hours of booking and receive a full refund, or cancel anytime up to seven days before the start of your trip and receive a 50% refund. Trips cancelled fewer than seven days in advance are not eligible for refunds. If you cancel within 24 hours of booking, please reach out to our team, as this refund has to be processed manually.   3. Check-in time is any time after 4 pm. Check-out time is any time before 11 am. You're welcome to request an early check in or late checkout, but this is not guaranteed and we can only confirm 24 hours in advance. 4. We do not allow smoking of any kind, including but not limited to nicotine, tobacco derived products and/or cannabis derived substances; breaking this rule will incur a $300 fine. 5. Most of our locations do not allow pets. 6. Generally, parties or excessive noise are not allowed in our locations. I
host_about: Sonder is reimagining the way people travel. Now in 20+ cities, we’ve been featured in The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, and named 2019’s most innovative hospitality brand by Fast Company. We’ve taken the best parts of home and hotel and combined them into an entirely new experience. All of our spaces are uniquely designed, have 24/7 guest support, and contain all the essentials you need for an impeccable stay. No matter what you’re looking for, there’s a Sonder for you.

name: Spacious 3BR in Seaport by Sonder
summary: At this Sonder, you'll love the cozy and inviting living area with beautiful natural light, spacious private balcony, and modern fully-equipped kitchen with stainless steel appliances and ensuite laundry. Located in Seaport, you're at the center of one of Boston's best design and culture scenes, and close to an assortment of wonderful museums, diverse restaurants, and lively entertainment.
space: NA
description: At this Sonder, you'll love the cozy and inviting living area with beautiful natural light, spacious private balcony, and modern fully-equipped kitchen with stainless steel appliances and ensuite laundry. Located in Seaport, you're at the center of one of Boston's best design and culture scenes, and close to an assortment of wonderful museums, diverse restaurants, and lively entertainment. Bordering downtown Boston, the Seaport District is a beautiful and convenient area for all travelers in the Boston area. During the summer, Blue Hills Bank Pavilion, Boston Harborwalk, and nearby beaches attract tourists looking to soak up some New England sun. If you're here for work, the nearby Seaport World Trade Center and Boston Convention and Exhibition Center are huge hubs for business travelers because of the neighborhood's proximity to Logan International Airport. However, you may want to bring along the family to explore the nearby Boston Children's Museum, Boston Tea Party Ships & Museum,
neighborhood_overview: Bordering downtown Boston, the Seaport District is a beautiful and convenient area for all travelers in the Boston area. During the summer, Blue Hills Bank Pavilion, Boston Harborwalk, and nearby beaches attract tourists looking to soak up some New England sun. If you're here for work, the nearby Seaport World Trade Center and Boston Convention and Exhibition Center are huge hubs for business travelers because of the neighborhood's proximity to Logan International Airport. However, you may want to bring along the family to explore the nearby Boston Children's Museum, Boston Tea Party Ships & Museum, and the Institute of Contemporary Art.
notes: The third bedroom in this Sonder does not have a window.

name: QUEEN FUTON IN LARGE PRIVATE ROOM. SLEEPS 2 to 4
summary: The bed is in a huge room with another bed on the other end of the room.  There is also a futon couch and a high table with stools.
space: Laundry & bathroom next to room. Fits 4 comfortably.  Tiled room cleaned regularly. Clean linens & towels given to guests.
description: The bed is in a huge room with another bed on the other end of the room.  There is also a futon couch and a high table with stools. Laundry & bathroom next to room. Fits 4 comfortably.  Tiled room cleaned regularly. Clean linens & towels given to guests. Bathroom, kitchen shared.  You may use the living room too as long as I dont have guests over. Use of laundry anytime free during your stay. I will be present during your stay but we will only interact if you want too. I will not be in your business. I want you to enjoy your stay, feel comfortable and stress free while your under my roof I love living South Boston (Southie) the best neighborhood in boston! Also conveniently located within only 3 miles of all major landmarks, neighborhoods and highways. Also the friendliest residents in Boston. Walking distance of the beach, bars and restaurants and the seaport. Less then 2 miles from famous Fenway park, Boston Garden, fanuel hall, Downtown and the Northend (lil Italy) Two train station
neighborhood_overview: I love living South Boston (Southie) the best neighborhood in boston! Also conveniently located within only 3 miles of all major landmarks, neighborhoods and highways. Also the friendliest residents in Boston. Walking distance of the beach, bars and restaurants and the seaport. Less then 2 miles from famous Fenway park, Boston Garden, fanuel hall, Downtown and the Northend (lil Italy)
notes: Need to do your laundry no problem, have a red eye flight n want to shower at 3 a.m. no problem. Can't sleep and want to watch Netflix and chill all night no problem. Our home is your home. Help yourself to water etc in the fridge
transit: Two train stations less than .5 miles away. And 4 connecting bus stops within 3 blocks.
access: Bathroom, kitchen shared.  You may use the living room too as long as I dont have guests over. Use of laundry anytime free during your stay.
interaction: I will be present during your stay but we will only interact if you want too. I will not be in your business. I want you to enjoy your stay, feel comfortable and stress free while your under my roof
house_rules: Always use the back sliding doors. Also VERY IMPORTANT - Before coming in do not open the baby/pet gate without opening the curtain and making sure their are no dogs at the gate able to run out when your coming in please we appreciate it. And then again when you leave the house just make sure the door is locked and the baby gate is closed properly Only other house rules are to Just be respectful, curtious and Clean up after yourself:)
host_about: Friendly, funny, mind my own business type of person. I like to stick to myself, relax after work reading or starting a on Netflix binge. Responsible, Animal lover w/a me casa su casa personality. From Boston my whole life and can direct any guest to the best tourism in the city as well as the best 'off the grid' places.

name: Boston Room 1dbl Bed + Free Roundtrip Subway Card
summary: Cozy air conditioned private bedroom in south Boston apartment: *5 minute walk to the MBTA red line subway Andrew station, just 2 stops from south station transit hub.  Easy access to Convention Center & downtown. Includes free roundtrip subway smartcard. Easy access for Uber/Lyft trips; *Private room in 2 bedroom apt with host living in the 2nd bedroom; *Includes ameneties like coffee, bottled water, slippers, bedside AC & USB outlet  charging station, fastest available WiFi, and toiletries;
space: Furnished private guest bedroom with a full size (double) bed in a 2 bedroom apt. The guest room is off the living room in the front of the house.  Guest room has air conditioning, shelves, hanging space for clothes, iron/ironing board, charging station, sheets and towels provided. One shared bathroom.  I live in the 2nd bedroom in the apt, so you would share the apt with at most 1 person.
description: Cozy air conditioned private bedroom in south Boston apartment: *5 minute walk to the MBTA red line subway Andrew station, just 2 stops from south station transit hub.  Easy access to Convention Center & downtown. Includes free roundtrip subway smartcard. Easy access for Uber/Lyft trips; *Private room in 2 bedroom apt with host living in the 2nd bedroom; *Includes ameneties like coffee, bottled water, slippers, bedside AC & USB outlet  charging station, fastest available WiFi, and toiletries; Furnished private guest bedroom with a full size (double) bed in a 2 bedroom apt. The guest room is off the living room in the front of the house.  Guest room has air conditioning, shelves, hanging space for clothes, iron/ironing board, charging station, sheets and towels provided. One shared bathroom.  I live in the 2nd bedroom in the apt, so you would share the apt with at most 1 person. Guest bedroom, Kitchen, living room, back porch.  Coffee and bottled water provided.  Luggage storage availab
neighborhood_overview: Classic South Boston neighborhood, close to subway, downtown (Website hidden by Airbnb) , Summer Street convention center, seaport district. Quiet residential street.  Easy access to coffee shops, bars, restaurants.
notes: The included Airbnb guidebook has local recommendations and resources for your trip.  Self service or in person checkin will be available depending on my travel schedule.  I work in the IT field in Boston, and travel often.  I can answer questions by text or in person if I am in town.
transit: 5 minute walk to MBTA subway red line Andrew Station. Uber, Lyft, bus.  Fifteen minute drive to Logan airport, less then 10 minute drive to South Station for Amtrak & south commuter trains.  Easy drive or subway to Boston Summer Street Convention center & seaport district, and Boston Medical Center, south end, back bay.  Its faster getting home to here because you can take either the Ashmont or Braintree subway train line, your right in the city of Boston before the train lines split off separately!  10 minutes by Uber/Lyft to almost any downtown Boston location.  You can also save with UberPool or LyftLine in Boston!
access: Guest bedroom, Kitchen, living room, back porch.  Coffee and bottled water provided.  Luggage storage available including in between visits for repeat guests.  A nearby same day pickup/delivery service available for laundry.
interaction: I can help answer any questions, and I'm often away on the weekends.
house_rules: Smoking only on back porch or outside. No partys or events, quiet residential street. - Quiet Hours 11:00pm to 7:00am No garage or parking. No pets, but service animals welcome. Also always lock the exterior door when you come in go from the house. Remembering to lock the door is the most important house  rule as the neighbors are very sensitive if the door is left unlocked. In many cases, you will receive self service check in instructions if i am traveling during your stay.
host_about: I've lived & grown up in the Boston area, and enjoy tech, travel, and going out.

name: Flats on D. Great Place to have fun.
summary: Beautiful one and half bedroom apartment across from the Boston Convention Center and two minute walk to Seaport. Apartment will be empty except for airbed in master, towels and toilet paper. Close to Silver Line: ten minute ride to airport.
space: Great place to have fun while in Boston. I will check in daily.
description: Beautiful one and half bedroom apartment across from the Boston Convention Center and two minute walk to Seaport. Apartment will be empty except for airbed in master, towels and toilet paper. Close to Silver Line: ten minute ride to airport. Great place to have fun while in Boston. I will check in daily. Guests will have access to all Flats on D facilities. Rooftop Deck (with incredible Boston Views); Gym. I will stop by apartment daily to make sure all satisfactory. I know Boston like the back of my hand and am happy to provide guidance. Beautiful South Boston. City at its best. 10-15 minute walk to downtown. On foot, T and Silver Line.

neighborhood_overview: South Boston is an urban neighborhood with a strong sense of history and tradition. South Boston became a largely working-class neighborhood, with residents finding work on the South Boston waterfront or in factories such as Gillette, which still employs local residents.  South Boston, most popularly known as Southie, was once a predominantly working class Irish Catholic community, with residents finding work on the South Boston waterfront or in factories such as Gillette, which still employs local residents. Now it is changing dramatically and has become increasingly desirable among young professionals and families.  Fort Point is a hub for the arts community, and has a large population of working artists. South Boston’s beaches are popular with all ages, and Mayor Walsh recently created a family friendly beach at the Curley Community Center.  Mayor Walsh has also made upgrading South Boston’s infrastructure a priority.  An unprecedented number of streets have been repaved, a dilapida
notes: Please always turn the hood on when you cook, to prevent smoke / fire alarm going off. Insurance mandates central station fire alarm monitoring. If the smoke alarm goes off locate panel for fire. If there is no danger, press 1111 to silence alarm.  Please do not park in the driveway next to the building.  NO SMOKING inside or outside on the property. Parking is free from 10 AM to 6PM, however avoid designated handicap spot close to the front of the home. Resident only parking from 6 PM to 10 AM. For overnight parking, please park in the garages that permit parking close to the house.  Around this area there is also street cleaning every month, Please check the signs, if not followed could lead to Parking and ticket and getting your car towed. If in case you are towed please go to (URL HIDDEN)  If you know your license plate number, you can search our online database  (URL HIDDEN) or call the Boston Police Department at (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) to find out which company towed your car. Ple
transit: Transportation. South Boston is served by two Massachusetts Bay Transportation Authority Red Line rapid transit stations: Broadway and Andrew. In addition due to the development and revitalization of the South Boston Waterfront area, lead to the opening of a new station in South Boston. This new station was built and given the name of World Trade Center Station, this new location can be found on Congress St. in South Boston Waterfront. This is an affordable and safe way to travel throughout the Boston area. A ticket costs under $3 while an unlimited pass will cost $75. MBTA bus service connects these stations with the residential areas of South Boston, downtown Boston and the Back Bay. The MBTA Silver Line, a Bus rapid transit service running partly in a tunnel from South Station, also serves the north side of South Boston. South Boston is also served by five bus routes including the numbers 5, 7, 9, 10, 11. Similarly to the subway, the busing industry in South Boston also benefited fr
access: Please do not park in the driveway next to the building.  FREE Parking for 1 car, is a Lot a few blocks from the house. Entire Home 3 floors, 2 decks, and backyard. Please avoid the underneath covered lower deck, as it is for the lower unit. Please do not access the door outside the kitchen to the lower unit. That door is locked. The closet next to the half bath next to the kitchen is also locked and for our personal use only. NO PARKING IN DRIVEWAY NEXT TO THE BUILDING. It's the NEIGHBOR'S PRIVATE DRIVEWAY. YOUR CAR WILL BE TOWED.
interaction: We prefer to be respect the privacy of guests and provide smart lock and easy check in. We are available if needed and you can reach preferably via Airbnb messages ( it sends an email, text, Airbnb Alert on our Phone App automatically to us). In case you needed you can also call us and text us.
house_rules: Please do not park in the driveway next to the building.  NO SHOES in the house, please leave them at the entrance. WE DO NOT ALLOW BACHELOR OR BACHELORETTE PARTIES OR GROUPS STAYING AT OUR HOME. PLEASE DO NOT INSTANT BOOK if you are a Bachelor Party or Bachelorette Party, or planning host a party or social gathering. If you do book and are found having a party or you are part of a Bachelor/Bachelorette  Party, you will be violating our rules and will be fined $1500 and your deposit will not be refunded. Please ask and not instant book if you are planning to have a family dinner or get together. There might be extra cleaning fees etc...   • Check-in time is 3PM. Check out time is 10 AM No parties and please keep noise to a minimum after 9:30 pm. Please keep noise outside the house to a minimum. name: Entire home- great location at a special price!
summary: Located in the heart of Boston, our home is close to  many well-known attractions in the area. The beach is only a couple of minutes walking distance from our home. South Boston, known as "Southie" is a historic neighborhood with great bars, restaurants, and family-owned boutiques and businesses. host_about:
Hi Fellow Travelers!
 
I am Joanna, a current candidate in a Master’s program in Sustainable International Development at Brandeis! As a student in an international program, I truly value traveling in addition to music and other hobbies involving exploring the world. I believe Airbnb is a great platform for anyone who wants to travel and enjoys visiting different places and cultures! 
 
I've lived in Spain, grew up in North Carolina, and now consider myself a Bostonian. My home in South Boston is very comfortable and right next the beach where I enjoy jogging in the mornings! I would like to share my place while I'm Airbnbing since I believe my home will bring happiness and a true Boston experience :) 
 
When I'm not traveling or studying, I enjoy nonfiction books such as "A New Earth Awakening" By Eckhart Tolle or simply relaxing at the beach near Castle Island. 
 
As a host, I will do my best to provide you with a very comfortable stay in my home and provide with the very best tips for visiting Boston. As a guest, I will respect your home and truly appreciate the space given to me.

name: Trendy Flat|Bright + Light Southie| 1BR 1BA #201
summary: Brand new property completed July 2015! Located on West Broadway St in South Boston, this one bedroom suite features a full sized, open kitchen and living room. Perfect for groups of up to 4 people looking for an accommodation. This building is part of hostel style living accommodations, so along with 3 private apartments there are 15 hostel units. Rest assured this apartment is completely private and only you will have access.
space: The kitchen in this gorgeous 2nd floor unit is fully-equipped with appliances, including refrigerator, range with oven, microwave, pots/pans and cooking utensils. In the living room, there is a 40" flat screen TV with cable and a sofa bed that comfortably sleeps two additional guests. This unit has a desk in the living area that can also be pulled out as a dining table, accommodating up to four people. The large bedroom has a queen size bed, dresser and plenty of closet space. There are high ceilings and polished hard wood flooring throughout the unit. The space gets great light and overlooks West Broadway Street.

neighborhood_overview: The location could not be more perfect with all of South Boston at your doorstep and the wildly popular Seaport District just a short walk away. South Boston, or “Southie” as we call it, is best known for its authentic Boston feel, its proximity to Downtown and it’s bar and pub scene, while the Seaport District has quickly become the destination for conferences, restaurants and night-life/entertainment. With the Red Line Subway station right outside the front door you can also access the Downtown/Financial District, Beacon Hill and Cambridge/MIT/Harvard very easily.
notes: This unit is only accessed by stairs, no elevator. Access is via code activated doors. Once you have a confirmed reservation you will receive an email from our management company confirming the details of your stay and the exact process to access the building and the unit. Pack and play is available upon request. You will have access to your unit and the common laundry room.
transit: The Red Line subway station is across the street which provides you access to almost anywhere in metro Boston. Logan Airport is a 5 minute taxi ride; Harvard University and MIT are a short train ride away. All the major hospitals in the City are also accessible from this location. And finally, Boston Convention and Exhibition Center is a walk, or very short cab ride away. Hynes Convention is accessible via the subway.
access: We used code locks, not keys, so you can check in at any time after the 4pm check in time.
interaction: We have prepared for your stay so that you don't need to interact with us at all during your stay. You have complete privacy.

host_about: Husband, father, friend and real estate enthusiast. Long time Airbnb host and traveller. Small business owner and operator. Interests include food and drink, sports and nutrition, golf, anything Italy, joking around and having fun and anything that fits in to those categories!

You will have access to your unit and the common laundry room.
transit: The Red Line subway station is across the street which provides you access to almost anywhere in metro Boston. Logan Airport is a 5 minute taxi ride; Harvard University and MIT are a short train ride away. All the major hospitals in the City are also accessible from this location. And finally, Boston Convention and Exhibition Center is a walk, or very short cab ride away. Hynes Convention is accessible via the subway.
access: We used code locks, not keys, so you can check in at any time after the 4pm check in time.
interaction: We have prepared for your stay so that you don't need to interact with us at all during your stay. You have complete privacy.

host_about: Husband, father, friend and real estate enthusiast. Long time Airbnb host and traveller. Small business owner and operator. Interests include food and drink, sports and nutrition, golf, anything Italy, joking around and having fun and anything that fits in to those categories!

name: Stayloom’s Saltspray Escape | Beachfront
summary: Stayloom is dedicated to giving you a luxurious and authentic travel experience. From the refurbished table to the local artwork, our homes are furnished so every detail has a genuine connection to the surrounding community. Spacious and suitable for groups of all sizes, each Stayloom home is crafted with the intention of bringing family and friends together. Stay in style. Stay for the stories. Stayloom.
space: Spacious, professionally designed, and featuring panoramic beachfront views, this contemporary Stayloom home is a modern homage to the crisp chic and casual comfort of the Cape Cod aesthetic. Loaded with modern amenities, this place is the perfect space for large groups, families, and companies coming to town on business who seek first class accommodations in Boston. - Open-concept living area designed for large groups - Can comfortably accommodate up to 20 guests - Chef’s kitchen filled with essential cookware - Central air conditioning and heat, laundry (washer/dryer/iron), and high speed internet - Two off-street parking spots - Private deck with patio furniture - All beds feature Tempurpedic-quality mattresses and silky, high thread count linens. - All bathrooms are immaculate and include essential toiletries and stacks of plush cotton towels.

neighborhood_overview: Located across from the M Street Beach in Boston’s beloved and storied “Southie” neighborhood, our home is within easy striking distance of downtown and within walking distance to local shops, galleries, and a vibrant restaurant and bar scene. Dig your toes into the sand at the M Street Beach, or take a morning stroll along the water on the Boston HarborWalk. All guests after booking will receive a personalized list of recommendations including locals favorite spots, restaurants, and activities. We will provide detailed information and guides on the surrounding area to enhance your overall experience.
notes: If you have questions you need answered before securing your booking, or you simply want to talk with us first, reach out to our Stayloom team with an inquiry before a reservation request.  Please also note that one-night stays on the weekend or reservations that start or end on a Saturday may be subject to an additional fee. Want more options? Check out Stayloom’s other homes located in popular destinations across the nation such as Boston, Savannah, New Orleans, and more! At Stayloom, we make sure you find the perfect fit. Damage deposit: $500 (non-Airbnb reservations only)
transit: Walk up one block to E 8th Street where guests can catch the #11 MBTA bus that runs regularly to and from the Broadway subway station on the Red Line, which will then take you downtown in just minutes. Or, continue past Broadway station on the #11 bus to Essex Street in Chinatown (located downtown, just one block from Boston Common). In addition to the #11 bus, the closest subway station is Andrew Station. For those who feel adventurous, the nearest Hubway bicycle rental location is a 10-15 minute walk. For $6/day, you can enjoy access to a bike that can be dropped off at one of the 160+ locations across the city.  If biking or public transport isn’t your thing, there are several private transportation options at your disposal.
access: The entire home is for your exclusive use.
interaction: You will have complete privacy here, however every question or concern you may have before or during your stay will be promptly addressed via messenger or phone. In the case of a maintenance emergency, our ground team is available to assist you. Entry is simple, there’s no need to coordinate key pick up.
house_rules: - Please respect Boston's noise ordinance. Quiet hours begin at 11:00pm, weekdays & weekends. Thank you for helping to keep good relations with our neighbors! - Any visit from the local police department will result in immediate eviction without refund. - We do not permit bachelor or bachelorette parties at this property. However, we have plenty of other homes that can accommodate these sorts of gatherings. Please message us for more information!
host_about:
I am a proud member of the Stayloom network! My personal loves include my new daughter, traveling with my family, and trying to beat the NYT crossword puzzle. Part of the joy for me is in providing a platform to let you discover what I love about my two favorite cities: Boston and New York. I hope I have the chance to show you their amazing energies and vibrant cultures.

Cheers,
Franklin
Stay Heirloom

You are within a 1 minute walking distance of The liquor store, Dunkin' Donuts, 7 Eleven, Pizza , barbers and Anderw Red Line Train and Bus stations that go anywhere from Downtown to the outskirts of Boston and beyond, A 5 minute walk to large parks and beaches at Castle Island. Within 10- 20 minutes you could be Downtown, at the 17th century Fort Independence or do all your shopping at South Bay Mall.

neighborhood_overview: This studio is located in the heart of "Southie" with a long history. Home of many immigrants of Irish decent in the early 20th century leaving a legacy that which is still Palpable today. As an inner city located unit it is not the safest to walk after dark. I have been living here for 3 years and constantly walk at night and never had any problems.
notes: House Rules:  1. No Smoking of Any Substance inside 2. Noise level must be kept to a minimum for there are neighbors above and to one side.  3. No drugs my be used inside the unit.  4. No pets are allowed.
transit: The cities main train "Red Line" is nearly across the street; a thirty second walk. There are also buses that bring you almost anywhere in Boston.
access: An illuminated lock box has been placed out side of the door and has the keys inside.  The Kitchen is available for use with a microwave, coffee maker, blender, electric stove and refrigerator.
interaction: I am a male host. I do have a room to myself in the same with its own entrance/ exit. I am unusually off site due to work or travel but this room that i reserve for myself is locked off from both sides and only should be opened in events of emergency or request.  I will be in and out of my own unit only.  I will not use the bathroom or kitchen during your stay.
house_rules: Quiet Hours 11pm - 6am No Drug Use Eat grapes on the grape vine at your own risk!
host_about: I am a half Turkish- half Irish American Architecture Student here in Boston. I grew up here and love the city and look forward to hosting visitors.

neighborhood_overview: South Boston is an urban neighborhood with a strong sense of history and tradition. South Boston became a largely working-class neighborhood, with residents finding work on the South Boston waterfront or in factories such as Gillette, which still employs local residents. South Boston, most popularly known as Southie, was once a predominantly working class Irish Catholic community, with residents finding work on the South Boston waterfront or in factories such as Gillette, which still employs local residents. Now it is changing dramatically and has become increasingly desirable among young professionals and families. Fort Point is a hub for the arts community, and has a large population of working artists. South Boston’s beaches are popular with all ages, and Mayor Walsh recently created a family friendly beach at the Curley Community Center. Mayor Walsh has also made upgrading South Boston’s infrastructure a priority. An unprecedented number of streets have been repaved, a dilapidated
notes: Insurance mandates central station fire alarm monitoring. If the smoke alarm goes off locate panel for fire. If there is no danger, press 1111 to silence alarm.  NO SMOKING, anywhere on the property, inside or outside. Parking is free from 10 AM to 6PM, however avoid designated handicap spot close to the front of the home. It is "Resident only" parking from 6 PM to 10 AM. For overnight parking, please park in the garages that permit parking close to the house. Around this area there is also street cleaning every month, Please check the signs, if not followed could lead to Parking and ticket and getting your car towed. If in case you are towed please go to (URL HIDDEN) If you know your license plate number, you can search our online database (URL HIDDEN) or call the Boston Police Department at (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) to find out which company towed your car. The nearest public parking garage nearby is VPNE 12 Drydock Ave, Boston, MA 02210 It's a 15 min walk back or take the bus #7 back to
transit: Transportation. South Boston is served by two Massachusetts Bay Transportation Authority Red Line rapid transit stations: Broadway and Andrew. In addition due to the development and revitalization of the South Boston Waterfront area, lead to the opening of a new station in South Boston. This new station was built and given the name of World Trade Center Station, this new location can be found on Congress St. in South Boston Waterfront. This is an affordable and safe way to travel throughout the Boston area. A ticket costs under $3 while an unlimited pass will cost $75. MBTA bus service connects these stations with the residential areas of South Boston, downtown Boston and the Back Bay. The MBTA Silver Line, a Bus rapid transit service running partly in a tunnel from South Station, also serves the north side of South Boston. South Boston is also served by five bus routes including the numbers 5, 7, 9, 10, 11. Similarly to the subway, the busing industry in South Boston also benefited fr
access: Entire Home 3 floors, 2 decks ( in the back on 1st floor and 3rd floor Master bedroom Suite level). Please do not access the door in the living room leading to stairs, to the lower unit. That door is locked. One closet on 3rd floor is  locked and for our personal or the cleaners use only. We have paid parking spot, please ask for the parking spot address and spot # to park 1 car.

We are available if needed and you can reach preferably via Airbnb messages ( it sends an email, text, Airbnb Alert on our Phone App automatically to us).
