neighborhood_overview: About Seaport:   Boston's Seaport neighborhood has always been a scenic enclave near downtown; now it's rapidly becoming the place to live, shop, dine out, and entertain. A stunning renewal is nearing completion that will transform this harbor-side district into one of the prime destinations for the region. Shopping for days. Dining that will leave you savoring even that final morsel. Entertainment to satisfy the vibrant, diverse community that is becoming the new Seaport. Super close to ICA (Institute of Contemporary Arts), Convention Center, Lawn on D, Moakley Courthouse and Boston Childrens Museum
notes: Please be sure to request any additonal items you may need during your stay and we will try to accomodate according to you needs. This area has a resurgence of high tech companies adding to the energy and vibe.
transit: 10 minute walk to Downtown. Close to Fanuel Hall and Aquarium as well. The train is very accessible and uber is also another option for a cheap ride to Back Bay or North End NEARBY TRANSPORTATION Subway Silver Line – Courthouse Station Red Line – South Station Commuter Rail – South Station Buses 4 – Courthouse Station  (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) – World Trade Centre Station  (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) – South Station Ferries F1 – Rowes Wharf Ferry Terminal F4, F2H – Long Wharf Ferry Terminal
access: Guest will have access to all community amenities such as:  24-hour fitness center Open spacious lounge  Outdoor Sun deck Business center Cyber lounge Smoke-free living Bicycle storage 24-hour package pickup Guests will have full access to the apartment including the kitchen, living/bedroom, and bathroom. The room is stocked with essential toiletries and any necessary towels and linens. Iron, ironing board, and hair dryer are also available for use. We stocked the kitchen with the essentials, if you're a big cook (like me!) please verify we have what you need and I can bring what we don't already have.
interaction: I am available by phone, email, or Messenger 24/7. Don’t hesitate to contact us if you need anything, from extra towels to restaurant recommendations. Otherwise, we’ll leave you to enjoy your stay.
house_rules: House Rules 1. You're welcome to request an early check in or late checkout and I can confirm in 24 hours. 2. We do not allow smoking; breaking this rule will incur a $300 fine. Most of our locations do not allow pets. 3. Generally, parties or excessive noise are not allowed in our locations. It may be possible to obtain permission to host a party; contact me to learn more. 4. If a location is left in an exceptionally messy state, we will charge $50 for every extra hour of cleaning required. 5. Guests take full responsibility for any accidents, injuries, or illnesses that occur while on the premises or its facilities. By accepting this reservation, it is agreed that all guests are expressly assuming the risk of any harm arising from their use of the premises. Guests recognize that they may personally purchase insurance to protect themselves in such events. 6. If more guests sleep at a location than the number originally stated in the booking, the security deposit will be charged in ful
host_about: Im a Boston native and happy to help you see the great parts of Boston that arent in the Guidebooks. I look forward to connecting with people traveling to Boston and aim to make each guest experience this beautiful place like a local. Thanks for checking out my place and I hope to talk to you soon!

We are steps away from all of the iconic Southie Bars, the famous Carson and M St. Beaches, and Boston’s largest shopping complex, S. Bay Mall which includes the brand new AMC Movie Theater! Local transportation is just around the corner too!  Come bring friends and family, it’s time to start your Boston adventure! Enjoy!!! ♥Miya
space: Welcome to the true ♥ of Boston! Our spectacular and modern apartment features 1400 sq ft. high ceilings and a large open concept, with a private outdoor deck and a back garden to enjoy a perfect glass of wine. The large open floor plan comes complete with kitchen, dining and living room, with plenty of seating for all of your guests. The kitchen is complete with all the necessities and fully equipped with cooking essentials, pots, pans, utensils, and dishware. Our home is gorgeous and we know you will love it! Not only is it perfect on the inside, but our location gives an access to the hottest parts of Boston! We are steps away from South Boston’s Broadway street  bars, restaurants, retail shops and S. bay Mall. neighborhood_overview: The North End, Boston’s Little Italy, is a maze of narrow streets with some of the city’s oldest buildings. On the self-guided Freedom Trail, tourists pass historic sites like the 1680 Paul Revere House and the Old North Church, which played a key role at the beginning of the Revolutionary War. Italian restaurants, coffeehouses, pastry shops and old-school delis pack the area, especially on lively Hanover Street.The South End is a culturally rich neighborhood with restored Victorian row houses surrounding charming English-style squares. Its popular dining and drinking scene spans family-friendly bistros, trendy eateries, gay bars and low-key pubs. The old warehouses of the SoWa Art & Design District house galleries, studios and home-decor shops. Artisans, farmers and food trucks gather at Sunday markets May through October. SouthieOld-school diners and taverns mingle with pizzerias and gastropubs. Marking a Revolutionary War site, the Dorchester Heights monument offers sweeping Boston

neighborhood_overview: The North End, Boston’s Little Italy, is a maze of narrow streets with some of the city’s oldest buildings. On the self-guided Freedom Trail, tourists pass historic sites like the 1680 Paul Revere House and the Old North Church, which played a key role at the beginning of the Revolutionary War. Italian restaurants, coffeehouses, pastry shops and old-school delis pack the area, especially on lively Hanover Street.Affluent Back Bay is a shopping and dining destination. Along Newbury Street, well-heeled locals frequent designer boutiques, fashion chains, art galleries and patio cafes set in elegant brick townhouses. Expansive Copley Square is flanked by 1800s landmarks Trinity Church and the Boston Public Library. Mansions dot the neighborhood’s tree-lined streets, many on Paris-inspired Commonwealth Avenue.

name: Beautiful, sunny 2 bedroom, 2 bath in South Boston
summary: Beautiful 2 bedroom, 2 bath home with incredible natural light and views of the Boston skyline. Newly built in 2016, this 3rd floor home is located off West Broadway and has nice finishings throughout. Walking distance to restaurants, coffee shops,  grocery store, South Boston Waterfront, Boston Tea Party Ship, Children's Museum, Boston Convention Center, Castle Island, and public transportation to downtown Boston.
space: The large living area opens into a designated dining space, a gourmet kitchen with a massive island and top of the line appliances, and a spacious private deck. Master bedroom features a queen bed,  private deck, large walk-in closet, and en-suite bathroom with dual sinks. The second bedroom has an oversized closet and a twin daybed that pulls out to a king. The second bathroom has a walk-in shower. Generously sized sectional in the living room can sleep an adult. Hardwood floors, in-unit laundry, central A/C, and garage parking complete this home. Amenities include WiFi, full use of kitchen utensils, Nespresso coffee maker, kettle, toaster, toiletries, etc. Travel crib available on request.

name: Must-see views, large master & private bath!
summary: Stay in Boston's best neighborhood and relax on two levels of private decks with city views. The master bedroom has ample space and lots of natural light. You'll have your own bathroom, space in the refrigerator, as well as access to all kitchen amenities. You're set with wifi, coffee, and laptop space, and have a shared TV for casting your favorite shows. BCEC, Renaissance & Aloft convention centers are within 1 mile. Note: You will have the place mostly to yourself if booking in May.
space: After living in five neighborhoods in Boston over eight years, there's a reason why I call the east side of South Boston, aka "Southie", home!  The neighborhood is incredibly safe and upscale, while maintaining a neighborhood feel. The apartment is located on a quiet side street where you can feel comfortable getting in and out of Ubers/Lyfts late at night. The beach is a short walk away, as well as well-lit parks, and downtown. We have incredible restaurants (happy to share recommendations), bikes for rental, and tons of events going on all the time. Within two blocks, there are cute coffee shops, boutiques, bars, restaurants, a library, fantastic sushi, a grocery store, at least six fitness studios, and more.

neighborhood_overview: You can't beat this location. Logan Airport is less than 10 minutes away (2.5 miles), South Station is 1.8 miles, and you can hop on major highways (90 & 93) by car in 2-3 minutes. The east side of South Boston is very safe and walkable at all hours. Street parking is available Friday night through Sunday.  The apartment is particularly well suited for conferences at the Boston Convention Center (20 minute walk, 1 mile drive) and professionals with business downtown (5 minute Uber/Lyft). Local hospitals are also close (Tufts - 2.5 miles, Mass General - 3.5 miles), as well as universities (UMass Boston, Northeastern, Berkelee, more). Or, use Southie as your home base to attend an event, or explore Boston's history.
notes: NA
transit: NA
access: Arrive at your leisure with self-check in.
interaction: I am a young professional working in tech, and keep standard hours. I'm often out and about, but usually will be available in the evenings if I'm not traveling. I love sharing recommendations when needed, but will otherwise respect your privacy.
house_rules: - No additional guests unless discussed when booking. - No recreational drugs or smoking of any kind - inside or outside. - Please keep noise to a minimum. This is a quiet street and neighbors live very close. - $50 fee for lost keys.
host_about: Hi there! I'm a young professional living in South Boston. I love everything about the history and vibrancy of our city - and try to take full advantage of everything it has to offer. When I'm not at my tech job, I'm dreaming up new business ideas, getting outside as much as possible, going to the beach with friends, or hitting up a cycling class. As a former transplant and wanderluster, I love traveling and hosting travelers. Some of my favorite places are Australia (I lived there for a few months), Croatia, Denver, Cape Cod, and my latest adventure - Iceland!

notes: Will to try to accommodate flexible check in/out times. Requests can be submitted for use of shared space as additional bedroom (couch or air mattress). An additional charge will be applied and approval must be determined prior to check-in. If you are looking for a long-term rental and there are times blocked off, check in to see if arrangements can be made. Parking: There are resident parking restrictions during the week between the hours of 6pm and 10am (Monday - Friday). For overnight parking, you can park on East or West Broadway, but 2 hour parking begins at 8am, therefore you would be required to move your vehicle by 10am. There are no weekend parking restrictions on the street that the condo is located on.   For weekend visitors, if you are arriving during standard check-in hours, you should not have an issue finding a spot on the street. Please carefully read the street signs when you park to be sure you are not violating any parking rules. I’d recommend using public transporta
transit: Uber and Lyft is always available within less than five minutes. The condo is a 2 minute walk from the closest bus stop and less than one mile from the MBTA train station. There is a free shuttle that accommodates rides within South Boston during the evening. 10 minute car ride from the airport.

neighborhood_overview: The North End is a neighborhood of Boston, Massachusetts, United States. It has the distinction of being the city's oldest residential community, where people have continuously inhabited since it was settled in the 1630 Affluent Back Bay is a shopping and dining destination. Along Newbury Street, well-heeled locals frequent designer boutiques, fashion chains, art galleries and patio cafes set in elegant brick townhouses. Expansive Copley Square is flanked by 1800s landmarks Trinity Church and the Boston Public Library. Mansions dot the neighborhood’s tree-lined streets, many on Paris-inspired Commonwealth Avenue. The South End is a culturally rich neighborhood with restored Victorian row houses surrounding charming English-style squares. Its popular dining and drinking scene spans family-friendly bistros, trendy eateries, gay bars and low-key pubs. The old warehouses of the SoWa Art & Design District house galleries, studios and home-decor shops. Artisans, farmers and food trucks gathe

summary: Relax in our gorgeous, fully renovated, 3 bedroom 2 full bathroom townhouse located in South Boston! Central location - easy access to downtown Boston, Seaport District, Convention Center (BCEC), Airport, Train, Bus Stops, Subway (MBTA) Station and numerous restaurants/shops! Located in a safe residential neighborhood close to several parks and the beach! This townhouse has 3 floors of privacy and is perfect for couples, business travelers, and families. Don't miss this new to AirBnB property!
space: The home provides 3 bedrooms with 2 full bathrooms.  The first floor offers open-concept living and kitchen area with granite counters, stainless steel appliances, breakfast bar, and dining nook. Beautiful bay windows on two sides let in a lot of natural light! Second floor offers two bedrooms, both with queen size beds. Both bedrooms have several large windows allowing abundant natural light. One of the bedrooms has a brand new Casper mattress! A spa-like bathroom rounds out this floor.  The third floor offers a luxurious master bedroom (queen size bed) with a custom walk-in closets. The master bathroom boasts two sinks, jacuzzi tub, and tile shower. Another new Casper bed can be found here along with an assortment of pillows. All linens, towels, and basic toiletries are provided. Hair dryers can be found in both of the bathrooms and there is an iron/ironing board as well. name: 3br house in S. Boston, near Seaport,BCEC&downtown
summary: This house was built in 1850. We renovated it ourselves in the last few years. The house now has a unique old character with a modern touch. Close to Seaport, BCEC, and downtown. Tens of restaurants and cafes in less than 10min walk. 10 min walk to a beautiful sand beach with running trail. 15 min ride to the airport, bus stops at the corner, subway (Broadway station) in 15 min walk. Finding parking for non residents can be difficult. Uber/subway is very convenient if you are staying in town.
space: The house layout is in Three floor. The first floor living, dining and kitchen, and one (old) full bathroom.  Second floor: 2 bedrooms (queen beds) and a modern bathroom.  Third floor (attic): 3rd bedroom with queen bed with a piano! We have a complete kitchen with whatever you might need to make a perfect meal for yourselves. A good collection of spice, coffee/tea and cereal to enjoy. No parties or events. Quiet time between 10pm-8am.

name: Private Modern South Boston Room w/ City Views
summary: Located just off of historic Dorchester Heights, this private updated South Boston top floor guest room with a queen size bed and private new bathroom in a charming 1800s home. This room has stunning views of the city in a quiet neighborhood. There are no other bedrooms or bathrooms on this floor. When you hit the top of those stairs, consider it your very own penthouse suite. :)
space: Our place is a 3 story home dating back to 1880 - recently renovated in the last year, maintaining it's originality while bringing it up to date. This updated guest room and bathroom (newly added in June 2018) features a new 2018 queen size Casper mattress, luggage rack, small cooler fridge (enough for 6 cans), ironing board/iron, hair dryer, hooks/hangers, AC and city views. You also have a ceiling fan and your own Nest thermostat on your floor that can be dialed up to your comfort.  Walk to Seaport/BCEC/downtown.

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood offers lots of charm with restaurants, coffee shops and boutiques all in less than a 5 min walk making it extremely accessible. The beach is a 10 minute walk or a 5 minute drive. While it was once instrumental in final evacuation of the British from Boston in the Revolutionary War, Dorchester Heights is now a well kept and protected park that has gorgeous views of the the city (1 min walk). - a must see!
notes: We have a small 25 lb. dog - hypoallergenic, non-shedding, quiet and extremely friendly.
transit: Modes of transport: Bus: 2-4 min walk for downtown buses (Buses 9, 10, 11). Train: 10-15 min walk to Broadway or Andrew Sq. T stops. These are Red Line stops, allowing access to South Station, downtown, Cambridge, Somerville and more. Uber: Very reasonable and always available in this neighborhood. Great alternative to driving.  Points of interest: Walking distance (less than 5 min) to convenience/coffee shops (7/11, PS Gourmet, Dunkin Donuts, Cafe Nero), restaurants (Loco, Capo, Certified Meatball Company, Lincoln, Fat Baby) and boutiques (Covet, Pretty Reckless, Neatly Nested). Boston’s innovation district - Seaport/waterfront area is very close - walkable (20-25 min) or Uber distance (7-9 min). Filled with lots of restaurants, bars and shopping! It is a 5 min drive ride or a 25 min walk to BCEC and a 9 min drive or 30 min walk to Seaport World Trade Center if you are here for a convention.  Dorchester Heights is a 1 min walk. It is a 4 min drive or 10 min walk to the beach. It is a

house_rules: Please remove your shoes before you head upstairs. You may leave them in the front area or bring them up with you, whichever you feel most comfortable with. Thank you!
host_about: Long time Boston resident and people enthusiast! :)

name: Private Bedroom in Updated Southie Condo
summary: Wonderful South Boston location three blocks from the beach with private backyard, patio, and small deck. Fully renovated in 2008 with high end appliances, a gas fireplace, central air, and laundry.  Pictures are from a previous occupant, so the unit is decorated differently now.
space: Hello! Thanks for visiting my condo's profile page.  I live here and rent out the second bedroom occasionally. There is a shared bathroom and common space.  The condo is located three blocks from M street beach, about five blocks from Castle Island, and three blocks from several bus stops. The bus is about a ten minute ride to downtown Boston and South Station, where you can pick up the red line or silver line, the commuter rail lines that go to the south shore, and some Amtrak trains.
description: Wonderful South Boston location three blocks from the beach with private backyard, patio, and small deck. Fully renovated in 2008 with high end appliances, a gas fireplace, central air, and laundry.  Pictures are from a previous occupant, so the unit is decorated differently now. Hello! Thanks for visiting my condo's profile page.  I live here and rent out the second bedroom occasionally. There is a shared bathroom and common space.  The condo is located three blocks from M street beach, about five blocks from Castle Island, and three blocks from several bus stops. The bus is about a ten minute ride to downtown Boston and South Station, where you can pick up the red line or silver line, the commuter rail lines that go to the south shore, and some Amtrak trains. I have a big L-shaped couch, wireless internet, kitchen, and laundry you're welcome to use. There is room for groceries or leftovers if you'd like to keep some food in the refrigerator. I will usually have some coffee and tea av
neighborhood_overview: I live on a quiet street very close to the ocean and bus stops. There are also lots of urban amenities within walking distance, like restaurants, convenience stores, salons, and a Blue Bike dock (Boston's bike sharing system). South Boston recently got a Starbucks, but if you're looking for more traditional Boston coffee, there's a walkup Dunkin' Donuts on L Street.
notes: If you're going to be traveling by bus, definitely use the $0.99 Catch the Bus app to know when your bus will arrive (unless you'll be using the bus at peak times, in which case the 7 and 9 come about every 5 minutes).
transit: The #5, 7, 9, 10, and 11 buses stop within three blocks of the house. A Blue Bike dock is about a ten minute walk away, and there are three redline train stations (Andrew, Broadway, and South Station) within 1.5 miles.
access: I have a big L-shaped couch, wireless internet, kitchen, and laundry you're welcome to use. There is room for groceries or leftovers if you'd like to keep some food in the refrigerator. I will usually have some coffee and tea available that you're welcome to.  Guests aren’t permitted upstairs either to the upstairs deck or upstairs to the second floor condo.
interaction: I might meet guests to hand off the keys, but likely will direct guests to a lock box.
house_rules: I only share my space with female travelers.

name: Boston Apartment Seaport
summary: Bright, open one bedroom apartment in Seaport. Spacious apartments in Boston’s hottest neighborhood—the Seaport District. The Seaport District is where modern architecture, new restaurants, active nightlife and vibrant cultural institutions come together with an energy and vitality unlike anywhere else in the city. From the salty breezes to the spectacular views, the harbor buzzes with action and it’s ringed by the Harbor Walk, one of the world’s largest urban waterfront parks.
space: 24 hour indoor fitness center with outdoor yoga deck. Outdoor and indoor lounges, extended workspace and business center.
description: Bright, open one bedroom apartment in Seaport. Spacious apartments in Boston’s hottest neighborhood—the Seaport District. From the salty breezes to the spectacular views, the harbor buzzes with action and it’s ringed by the Harbor Walk, one of the world’s largest urban waterfront parks. 24 hour indoor fitness center with outdoor yoga deck. Outdoor and indoor lounges, extended workspace and business center. neighborhood_overview: In a city famous for its tangled, colonial streets, the Seaport District was designed and built for a modern lifestyle—with wide sidewalks, bike lanes, public transit, highways, waterways and direct access to Logan International Airport. It’s an unmatched transit hub that’s only a short walk (or ride) to downtown Boston. And you have immediate, on-site access to an MBTA station, as well as the Mass Pike and I-93.

name: Quiet, Private Bedroom in Southie's City Point
summary: Quiet, private room in South Boston's City Point neighborhood. Our home is located 3 blocks from M Street beach and Castle Island. Seaport and Fort Point are only minutes down the street, while Southie's fast-growing food and entertainment strip (Broadway) is only a few blocks away. Excellent location for those in town for an event at the Boston Convention Center. It is easily accessible via the 7 bus that stops 2 streets north of this home.  Logan international airport is 10 minutes away.
space: Our guest bedroom and home is peaceful and private. The bedroom is located at the top of the entrance stairs, so it's easy access. Our place is located on a quiet residential street in South Boston, super close to all downtown attractions and Boston's best food and entertainment scene. neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Seaport. Known as the “Innovation District” of the city. The Seaport is a waterfront community of high powered national companies, entrepreneurs, creatives and young families. Several start-ups and more traditional headquarters (including GE in 2019) are headquartered here, as well as many of the countries most desirable employers. The neighborhood is also home to Boston’s Convention Center, which draws global thinkers to the area. The Institute of Contemporary Art offers fantastic exhibitions and events. Locals love to dine out at innovative eateries and shop at unique boutiques in the newly-built developments. From Seaport, the expansive Boston Common park is just 12 minutes away by train, while several local beaches are within a short drive.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
transit: NA
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
house_rules: - Building amenities may have an extra cost - A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled - Same day check-ins are only guaranteed if booking is made before 4 pm - Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions, along with related fees. Guests should notify us of any pets prior to check-in (failing to do so will incur a penalty) - Parking is offered based on availability and is subject to a fee. - Blueground has the right to enter and inspect the apartment or to show the apartment to a potential tenant any day of the week between 9am and 6pm as long as the tenant has been informed via email at least one day in advance - Please contact us for details
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
Blueground is changing the way the world experiences furnished living.

We take perfectly located apartments and turn them into beautifully-designed and thoughtfully-equipped homes available for stays of 30 days or longer. 

Each Blueground property comes with modern furniture, premium linens, high-speed WiFi, and everything else you need to get up and running from day one.

All backed by our dedicated, on-the-ground support team, Blueground makes finding a new place to call home frictionless. Show up and start living with Blueground today.

Founded in 2013, Blueground is currently present in nine cities around the world and has a portfolio of more than 1500 premium properties... and growing.

name: WB Quarters™ by STRB|Hangout|Priv. Room|Shared BA
summary: This Quarters™ room is a unique offering from Short Term Rentals Boston that makes living in the heart of Boston affordable and easy. You have your own private room with a queen bed in a newly renovated building across the street from the Red Line Broadway Stop. The laundry room, kitchen and living room are shared amongst the guests of this building. The Quarters™ are our most popular offering for people who need to be in Boston but don't have the need or budget for a full apartment.
space: The shared bathrooms at Quarters™ are one in one out so you never have the awkward situation of actually sharing a bathroom. All areas and rooms have central heat and air conditioning and wi-fi is provided free of charge. The building common spaces are all professionally cleaned regularly so while we ask that everyone play their part in keeping the building neat and clean, we have a full staff of cleaners to ensure cleanliness and comfort. You get all of this and the flexibility of a short-term lease for a fraction of the cost of studio or apartment living in the City.

You get all of this and the flexibility of a short-term lease for a
neighborhood_overview: The location could not be more perfect with all of South Boston at your doorstep and the wildly popular Seaport District just a short walk away. South Boston, or “Southie” as we call it, is best known for its authentic Boston feel, its proximity to Downtown and it’s bar and pub scene, while the Seaport District has quickly become the destination for conferences, restaurants and night-life/entertainment. With the Red Line Subway station right outside the front door you can also access the Downtown/Financial District, Beacon Hill and Cambridge/MIT/Harvard very easily.
notes: You will be reserving one of the 15 units. All of the units include the same amenities and sleeping capacity, with the only difference being minor differences in the layout. Two days prior to your arrival, you will receive a pre-stay email directly from us that includes your room number, access codes, and other important information. PLEASE NOTE - There is no elevator in this building.
transit: The Red Line subway station is across the street which provides you access to almost anywhere in metro Boston. Boston Convention and Exhibition Center is a walk, or very short cab ride away. Hynes Convention is accessible via the subway. Logan Airport is a 5 minute taxi ride; Harvard University and MIT are a short train ride away. All the major hospitals in the City are also accessible from this location.
access: This building is only accessed by stairs, no elevator. Access is via code activated doors. Once you have a confirmed reservation you will receive an email from our management company confirming the details of your stay and the exact process to access the building and the unit.
interaction: We have prepared for your stay in a way that requires little to no interaction with us, unless of course you have an emergency, maintenance or management request in which case you will be provided contact information.
house_rules: NA
host_about: Husband, father, friend and real estate enthusiast. Long time Airbnb host and traveller. Small business owner and operator. Interests include food and drink, sports and nutrition, golf, anything Italy, joking around and having fun and anything that fits in to those categories!

neighborhood_overview: South Boston is a seaside Boston neighborhood with a rich cultural history. Within walking distance are several beautiful beaches, historic Castle Island, and many local restaurants and shops on Broadway.
notes: Parking in Boston, like other major cities is a challenge. Street parking, if available, can be found a few blocks away. Please check with us to help answer any questions regarding where to park.  Street parking is usually available before 4. We can help with early check in or luggage drop off to help with parking.  Paid parking across from our house may be available.
transit: Ideally located for exploring Boston. Two blocks from bus routes (5, 7, 9, 10, 11) that provide easy access to the Red, Orange, Green, and Silver subway lines, as well quick transit as to South Station (10 minutes via car and public transit), the Convention Center (7 minutes via car; 15 minutes public transit), and to Logan Airport (12 minutes via car; 30 minutes via public transit). Convenient location for ridesharing drop off/pick up, with most spots in the Seaport and Downtown about a 6 to 10 minute ride away.
access: We want you to feel welcome. In our Boston Tea Party Room Room, we have complimentary coffee, tea, and light refreshments for you to enjoy.  Printer, copier at your disposal
interaction: We live in a private apartment (with separate entrance) on the first floor, and our two guest suites are on the second floor. We are happy to be a resource to guests and to answer questions you may have during your stay.
house_rules: Maximum of 2 Guests per room. Must include names of all guests! Please respect our house and our other guests and keep noise to a minimum.
host_about: Third generation South Bostonian. History buff and Irish music devotee. Experienced business and leisure travelers.  Past owners of a travel agency, and c level business exec.  We bring our experience and expectations of a welcoming accommodation to our two suites for you to enjoy.

name: Cute & Cozy South Boston Condo
summary: Small, cozy one-bedroom condo in the heart of South Boston. Sleeps 4.
space: Our unit is one of three in a converted triple decker, just 4 blocks off of West Broadway in the heart of South Boston. Less than a 10 minute walk to Foodie’s grocery store, CVS, Lincoln Restaurant & Tavern, Capo Restaurant, and Loco Taqueria & Oyster Bar. Just over 1 mile from the Boston Expo & Convention Center. Additionally, we are right along the bus route and a 15-20 minute walk from the MBTA Red Line T Stop (Broadway). New floors, Queen sized bed, full-sized pull out sofa, back deck space, Cable, WiFi, dish washer, washer/dryer, and fully equipped kitchen space. While we make sure there is plenty of space for our guests, please note that we do live in this space, so the closet / dresser will contain our belongings as well.

neighborhood_overview: South Boston is a fun neighborhood full of delicious restaurants, fun bars and space to enjoy the outdoors on Castle Island’s running loop or at M Street Beach. Easy access to the rest of the city and to the highway (93).
notes: Please note that fire trucks travel by our condo frequently and their sirens can be very loud when the windows are open.
transit: You most definitely do not need a car to see the city from our location, but if you do choose to use a car, our location is in a great place for easy access to the highway and rest of the city. Parking is “street parking” and is primarily resident only, with some visitor spaces although tickets are rare on the weekends.
interaction: We are available to offer any recommendations or answer questions as needed, but will otherwise leave guests to enjoy their stay independently.
house_rules: Please be respectful of the space, as this is our home. We request that you leave dishes clean, or just load and run the dishwasher prior to departure. Also, please strip the bed sheets and pillow cases and put them in the bedroom hamper before leaving.
host_about: Our names are Jack & Olivia and we are young professionals living in South Boston and traveling as much as we can!

name: Quarters™ on DOT STRB - Private Room | Shared Bath
summary: This Quarters™ concept is a unique offering from Short Term Rentals Boston that makes living in the heart of Boston affordable and easy. You have your own private room with a queen bed in a newly renovated building with easy access bus and train stations. The kitchen and laundry facilities are shared amongst the guests of this building. The Quarters™ are our most popular offering for people who need to be in Boston but don't have the need or budget for a full apartment.
space: The shared bathrooms at Quarters™ are one in one out so you never have the awkward situation of actually sharing a bathroom.  All areas and rooms have baseboard heat and in window air conditioning (during the Summer).  Wi-fi is provided free of charge. The building common spaces are all professionally cleaned regularly so while we ask that everyone play their part in keeping the building neat and clean, we have a full staff of cleaners to ensure cleanliness and comfort. You get all of this and the flexibility of a short-term or long-term lease for a fraction of the cost of studio or apartment living in the City. The private rooms feature polished hard-wood floors, a queen size bed, a wardrobe for hanging and storing clothes, a desk and desk chair. There are two bathrooms on each floor stocked with shampoo, soap and conditioner. The fully equipped common kitchen is available for all guests of the building to use. When you put all the amenities together you get the functionality of a ful

neighborhood_overview: The location could not be more perfect with all of South Boston at your doorstep and the wildly popular Seaport District just a short walk away. South Boston, or “Southie” as we call it, is best known for its authentic Boston feel, its proximity to Downtown and it’s bar and pub scene, while the Seaport District has quickly become the destination for conferences, restaurants and night-life/entertainment. With the bus stops right outside the front door and the Red Line subway only a short walk, bus or cab ride away you can also access the Downtown/Financial District, Beacon Hill and Cambridge/MIT/Harvard very easily.
notes: You will be reserving one of the 11 units in the building. All of the units include the same amenities and sleeping capacity, with the only difference being the exact layout. PLEASE NOTE - There is no elevator in this building. This is a stairs only building, with no elevator or handicap access.
transit: The MBTA Bus Route picks up right outside the building. Logan Airport is fifteen minute taxi ride; Harvard University and MIT are a short bus ride away. The Red Line Broadway stop is a short walk down Broadway and from there you can get anywhere in Boston.
access: This unit is accessed using stairs (there is no elevator). Access is via code activated doors. Once you have a confirmed reservation you will receive an email from our management company confirming the details of your stay and the exact process to access the building and the unit.
interaction: We have prepared for your stay in a way that requires little to no interaction with us, unless of course you have an emergency, maintenance or management request in which case you will be provided contact information.

name: Quarters™ on DOT STRB - Private Room | Shared Bath
summary: This Quarters™ concept is a unique offering from Short Term Rentals Boston that makes living in the heart of Boston affordable and easy. You have your own private room with a queen bed in a newly renovated building with easy access bus and train stations. The kitchen and laundry facilities are shared amongst the guests of this building. The Quarters™ are our most popular offering for people who need to be in Boston but don't have the need or budget for a full apartment.
space: The shared bathrooms at Quarters™ are one in one out so you never have the awkward situation of actually sharing a bathroom.  All areas and rooms have baseboard heat and in window air conditioning (during the Summer).  Wi-fi is provided free of charge. The building common spaces are all professionally cleaned regularly so while we ask that everyone play their part in keeping the building neat and clean, we have a full staff of cleaners to ensure cleanliness and comfort. You get all of this and the flexibility of a short-term or long-term lease for a fraction of the cost of studio or apartment living in the City. The private rooms feature polished hard-wood floors, a queen size bed, a wardrobe for hanging and storing clothes, a desk and desk chair. There are two bathrooms on each floor stocked with shampoo, soap and conditioner. The fully equipped common kitchen is available for all guests of the building to use. When you put all the amenities together you get the functionality of a ful

You get all of this and the flexibility of a short
neighborhood_overview: The location could not be more perfect with all of South Boston at your doorstep and the wildly popular Seaport District just a short walk away. South Boston, or “Southie” as we call it, is best known for its authentic Boston feel, its proximity to Downtown and it’s bar and pub scene, while the Seaport District has quickly become the destination for conferences, restaurants and night-life/entertainment. With the bus stops right outside the front door and the Red Line subway only a short walk, bus or cab ride away you can also access the Downtown/Financial District, Beacon Hill and Cambridge/MIT/Harvard very easily.
notes: You will be reserving one of the 11 units in the building. All of the units include the same amenities and sleeping capacity, with the only difference being the exact layout. Three days prior to your arrival, you will receive a pre-stay email directly from us that includes your room number, access codes, and other important information. PLEASE NOTE - There is no elevator in this building. This is a stairs only building, with no elevator or handicap access.
transit: The MBTA Bus Route picks up right outside the building. Logan Airport is fifteen minute taxi ride; Harvard University and MIT are a short bus ride away. The Red Line Broadway stop is a short walk down Broadway and from there you can get anywhere in Boston.
access: This unit is accessed using stairs (there is no elevator). Access is via code activated doors. Once you have a confirmed reservation you will receive an email from our management company confirming the details of your stay and the exact process to access the building and the unit.
interaction: We have prepared for your stay in a way that requires little to no interaction with us, unless of course you have an emergency, maintenance or management request in which case you will be provided contact information.

name: Modern + Bright 2BR in Southie w/ Gym, by Blueground
summary: Discover the best of Boston, with this two-bedroom South Boston apartment with  views over the city. It’ll be easy to simply show up and start living in this lavishly Blueground furnished apartment with its fully-equipped kitchen, roomy living room, and our dedicated, on-the-ground support. (#BOS18)
space: Gorgeous furniture, fully-equipped kitchen, smart TV, and a premium wireless speaker are just a few of the amenities you’ll find inside this two-bedroom apartment. Ideally located in Boston, you’ll find a lot to love outside as well. When you’re ready to relax, you’ll be happy to discover every Blueground bedroom comes with superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and cozy towels. We handle everything so you can simply show up and start living.  This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry. Amenities Building amenities unique to this two-bedroom apartment include an on-site:    - Doorman - Pet Friendly - Gym - Garden - Courtyard - Bike Storage - Elevator
description: Discover the best of Boston, with this two-bedroom South Boston apartment with  views over the city. Amenities Building amenities unique to this two-bedroom apartment include an on-site:    - Doorman - Pet Friendly - Gym - Garden - Courtyard - Bike Storage - Elevator The entire apartment is yours
neighborhood_overview: This furnished rental is located in South Boston, a growing city neighborhood featuring an expansive waterfront playground and a strong diversity of restaurant and bar options.“Southie” as it is known by locals, is one of Boston’s most traditional areas, where everyone is bonded by a strong sense of community. Holidays are celebrated together with large, joyous parades. New restaurants and homes are rapidly rising along the industrial corridor where South Boston meets Seaport. Spend your weekends exploring Castle Island, a popular site of historic fortification, or take a long stroll down William Day Boulevard. As South Station is only 15 minutes away by train and 5 minutes by car, residents have a quick commute to the city center.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
transit: NA
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
house_rules: - Building amenities may have an extra cost - A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled - Same day check-ins are only guaranteed if booking is made before 4 pm - Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions, along with related fees. Guests should notify us of any pets prior to check-in (failing to do so will incur a penalty) - Blueground has the right to enter and inspect the apartment or to show the apartment to a potential tenant any day of the week between 9am and 6pm as long as the tenant has been informed via email at least one day in advance - Please contact us for details
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
Blueground is changing the way the world experiences furnished living.

We take perfectly located apartments and turn them into beautifully-designed and thoughtfully-equipped homes available for stays of 30 days or longer. 

Each Blueground property comes with modern furniture, premium linens, high-speed WiFi, and everything else you need to get up and running from day one.

All backed by our dedicated, on-the-ground support team, Blueground makes finding a new place to call home frictionless. Show up and start living with Blueground today.

Founded in 2013, Blueground is currently present in nine cities around the world and has a portfolio of more than 1500 premium properties... and growing.

name: Private Roof Deck! Overlooking Boston - Beautiful!
summary: Brand New and Beautiful Two Bedroom Apartment with your very own private roof deck!  Beautiful new building, white cabinets, stainless steel appliances, new beds and furniture.  Roof deck is huge and looks out to see Boston. Located in South Boston, easy to get to Seaport District, shops, restaurants.  My apartment is located on Dorchester Heights which is where George Washington and the Colonists exposed their cannons and the British abandoned their siege and left Boston, not to return.

house_rules: NO SMOKING in the apartment or in the building (and that includes weed/pot/marijuana) - if you smoke inside it's a $200 fine. NO DISTURBING MY NEIGHBORS - if they complain it's a $200 fine. NO PARTIES - $200 fine if you party.
host_about:
We have fallen in love with New England - we love the history and the variety of things to do and see.

My wife and I are originally from the West so being able to drive one hour and see Plymouth Rock, or Providence, RI has totally changed us.  We love to spend weekends exploring and adventuring with our kids.  We just returned from our biggest family trip yet - Singapore, Thailand, Cambodia, South Korea, and Vietnam for 3.5 months - it was amazing.

We would love to have you stay at our place!

name: The WOW 2 BDR apartment! Downtown Boston area #1
summary: Seven30 East Broadway offers beautiful new condos in South Boston. What seems like a typical residential building with simple windows, takes luxury up a notch. Inside this nondescript building, you may just find the apartment of your dreams.
space: 2 BED 2 BATH SLEEPS 5 Very Spacious floor plans, Fully-equipped kitchens, Living Room, Bedroom, Bathroom, in-unit Laundry Facilities, and Substantial Closet Space, all elaborately and intricately designed. This unique South Boston location will place you very conveniently next to seaport. Only 1 mile to the Boston Convention and Exhibition Center located right across the Reserve Channel, all within walking distance along a beautiful scenic route. With Stop & Shop directly across the street, Rite Aid in the back, and, encircled in many Dining, Shopping, and Entertainment options, everything is just a bit simpler. Not to worry, traveling is almost as easy. Just a few steps away from the L St. & E. Broadway intersection, makes transportation all the more convenient.

name: Roomy Boston place by the Sea
summary: Private room in gorgeous upscale condo in South Boston, aka, Southie. Classic Southie restaurant and bar, aka, “bah,” right next door—Seapointe.  Beach is a block away. Easy walk or public transit to Convention Center, and all of Boston.
space: You get a nice roomy bedroom on the first floor w two Twin Temprapedic beds. Push them together for a King.  Adjacent bathroom is all yours.  I dont provide breakfast, per se. Just coffee, tea, toast or bagel. You can keep any additional food in my frig tho. And feel free to use the microwave too.  Or I can set up a work desk in bedroom.
description: Private room in gorgeous upscale condo in South Boston, aka, Southie. Classic Southie restaurant and bar, aka, “bah,” right next door—Seapointe.  Beach is a block away. Easy walk or public transit to Convention Center, and all of Boston. You get a nice roomy bedroom on the first floor w two Twin Temprapedic beds. Push them together for a King.  Adjacent bathroom is all yours.  I dont provide breakfast, per se. Just coffee, tea, toast or bagel. You can keep any additional food in my frig tho. And feel free to use the microwave too.  Or I can set up a work desk in bedroom. Bedroom, private bath, limited kitchen use. I love meeting and talking w my guests, but its OK if you prefer to keep to yourself. Easy access to downtown and convention center. #11 bus passes wi 100 feet of front door. Andrew Sq MBTA station is 15 min walk away. Conv center is similaelr distance If you have a car, you can park in back. But let me know in advance, as certain restrictions apply.

host_about: I am an avid outdoorsy guy, hiking, biking, sailing, diving, lying on beaches and in hammocks. I also own an energy conservation company. So yeah, I'm green. But not obnoxiously so. Although if you're a guest here,  I will make you take that #@%^& plastic container out of the trash, wash it, and put it in recycling tho. LOL. . . . or I'll just do it myself .

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Seaport. Known as the “Innovation District” of the city. The Seaport is a waterfront community of high powered national companies, entrepreneurs, creatives and young families. Several start-ups and more traditional headquarters (including GE in 2019) are headquartered here, as well as many of the countries most desirable employers. The neighborhood is also home to Boston’s Convention Center, which draws global thinkers to the area. The Institute of Contemporary Art offers fantastic exhibitions and events. Locals love to dine out at innovative eateries and shop at unique boutiques in the newly-built developments. From Seaport, the expansive Boston Common park is just 12 minutes away by train, while several local beaches are within a short drive.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished rental is located in Boston’s Fort Point district, where a fort stood in colonial times. A small neighborhood located between the Seaport, South Boston, and Financial District, Fort Point provides ideal access to most of the cities largest employment nodes. The neighborhood has a long history as an epicenter of the Boston Art scene, as it offers numerous galleries and creative organizations. In addition to housing one of New England's largest artist bases, It is also home to many of Boston's new hip and upcoming restaurants and emerging technology companies.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished rental is located in South Boston, a growing city neighborhood featuring an expansive waterfront playground and a strong diversity of restaurant and bar options.“Southie” as it is known by locals, is one of Boston’s most traditional areas, where everyone is bonded by a strong sense of community. Holidays are celebrated together with large, joyous parades. New restaurants and homes are rapidly rising along the industrial corridor where South Boston meets Seaport. Spend your weekends exploring Castle Island, a popular site of historic fortification, or take a long stroll down William Day Boulevard. As South Station is only 15 minutes away by train and 5 minutes by car, residents have a quick commute to the city center.

Spend your weekends exploring Castle Island, a popular site of historic fortification, or take a long stroll down William Day Boulevard. As South Station is only 15 minutes away by train and 5 minutes by car, residents have a quick commute to the city center.

neighborhood_overview: Located in the heart of Boston’s beloved “Southie” neighborhood, guests can enjoy close proximity to downtown and convenient access to public transportation (bus). Whether you are in town for business, or you are looking for some time to unwind, our home’s central location is sure to suit your needs. Guests joining us for business travel can enjoy recharging from a busy day at work in a tranquil setting with convenient access to the BCEC, Seaport district, downtown, and financial district. There are also many fantastic nearby bars and restaurants to grab a bite or delicious cocktail. Or if you are craving a night in, everything you would want or need to create a delicious home-cooked meal is located within a mile of the home, including small boutique shops and larger supermarkets. South Boston also boasts a wonderful waterfront with numerous beaches, parks, and the historic Castle Island. Take a stroll to "The Lawn on D" for fun activities and music or visit the L Street Tavern, home t
notes: Our home is set in a quiet, family-centric neighborhood; out of respect for our neighbors, we ask that tenants keep noise to a minimum after 10:00pm.  Check in is any time between 3pm-2am though host will not respond after 10pm and check out is by 11am. You're welcome to request an early check in or late checkout, but this is not guaranteed.  For those considering bringing a private vehicle, please note that while there is ample street parking available in the area, it can be tricky to navigate as there are certain "resident-only" hours, particularly during the weekdays. From Monday to Friday, the vast majority of side streets only allow vehicles with a resident permit to park overnight. We would recommend that guests with a private vehicle download and use the app “Spot,” a reliable and budget-friendly option that allows you to rent parking from local parking spot owners by the hour, day, or week. Parking on Spot can be rented prior or during your visit depending on your needs. Paymen
transit: We are ~3-5 min walk to the nearest bus stop and ~1.3 miles from the nearest T stop. We are also located 1.5 miles from the convention center.
interaction: You will have complete privacy here. That said, we are available should you have any questions or needs during your stay and can be contacted via phone or email.

A small neighborhood located between the Seaport, South Boston, and Financial District, Fort Point provides ideal access to most of the cities largest employment nodes. The neighborhood has a long history as an epicenter of the Boston Art scene, as it offers numerous galleries and creative organizations. In addition to housing one of New England's largest artist bases, It is also home to many of Boston's new hip and upcoming restaurants and emerging technology companies.

space: Located on the Boston Harbor, this stylish apartment offers nothing but the best amenities to best suit your busy lifestyle and guarantee a comfortable stay. The beautiful high-rise includes a 24-hour attended lobby, a rooftop sky lounge and BBQ area, state-of-the-art fitness center with spectacular views, an entertainment lounge, business center with community workspaces, a community kitchen, a dog park, bike storage, valet dry cleaning, and short walks to transit and museums. Known as a world famous city, Boston has much to offer with its cultural aspects, fine dining options like, The Barking Crab and Papagayo, and sites worth seeing such as the Boston Harbor, Fenway Park, and Faneuil Hall Marketplace. Make sure to enjoy your stay at one of the most luxurious residences in the area. summary: Cozy studio in the heart of South Boston! We are located 1.5 miles from the BCEC and 1/2 mile from popular restaurants/bars. The space is set up like a traditional hotel room, equipped with keyless entry, a private bathroom with a shower/tub combo, TV, and a mini fridge/microwave.  Ideal for business travelers or singles/couples looking to enjoy the city! We provide all guests with a guide to getting around and our favorite local spots.
space: NA
description: Cozy studio in the heart of South Boston! We are located 1.5 miles from the BCEC and 1/2 mile from popular restaurants/bars. The space is set up like a traditional hotel room, equipped with keyless entry, a private bathroom with a shower/tub combo, TV, and a mini fridge/microwave.  Ideal for business travelers or singles/couples looking to enjoy the city! We provide all guests with a guide to getting around and our favorite local spots. We are available by email/text for any questions guests may have. We are located 2 blocks from the beach and 3 blocks from the main strip of restaurants/bars in South Boston. Guests visiting over Fri/Sat/Sun night are able street park in South Boston at no cost. There is no overnight street parking during weeknights, but there are several garages 1.5 miles away in Seaport. For guests without a car, the unit is located 3 blocks from the 7 bus which runs to the BCEC. An Uber to the convention center is about $8-9 each way.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Seaport. Known as the “Innovation District” of the city. The Seaport is a waterfront community of high powered national companies, entrepreneurs, creatives and young families. Several start-ups and more traditional headquarters (including GE in 2019) are headquartered here, as well as many of the countries most desirable employers. The neighborhood is also home to Boston’s Convention Center, which draws global thinkers to the area. The Institute of Contemporary Art offers fantastic exhibitions and events. Locals love to dine out at innovative eateries and shop at unique boutiques in the newly-built developments. From Seaport, the expansive Boston Common park is just 12 minutes away by train, while several local beaches are within a short drive.

name: Luxury Apartment with Water Views in Seaport
summary: This Apartment was designed with the sophisticated urban dweller in mind, these luxury apartment homes feature expansive, floor-to-ceiling windows, gorgeous hardwood flooring, and sleek modern materials and finishes.Apartment amenities include modern kitchens, expansive closets, luxe baths, in-home washers and dryers, central heat and air contionditioning, and g waterfront views. If you are looking for modern conveniences and exquisite interior and exterior design look no further.

This apartment features: Central heat and air conditioning Granite countertops Stainless steel appliances Washer and dryer full-size European-style cabinetry Premium Bathroom Finishes Tile backsplash Wood-style flooring 24-hour fitness center 2 Conference Rooms Business center Electric car charging stations On-site retail Rooftop Pool (seasonal) Sun deck 24-hour package pickup Bike storage Cyber lounge Parking garage Smoke-free community Yoga and Spin studio I am available by phone, email, or Messenger 24/7.
neighborhood_overview: About Seaport:   Boston's Seaport neighborhood has always been a scenic enclave near downtown; now it's rapidly becoming the place to live, shop, dine out, and entertain. A stunning renewal is nearing completion that will transform this harbor-side district into one of the prime destinations for the region. Shopping for days. Dining that will leave you savoring even that final morsel. Entertainment to satisfy the vibrant, diverse community that is becoming the new Seaport. Super close to ICA (Institute of Contemporary Arts), Convention Center, Lawn on D, Moakley Courthouse and Boston Childrens Museum
notes: Parking Garage available at additional fee and is based on availability. I have other apartments available in and around the area so feel free to shoot me a message with your dates and I can check other options for you!
transit: 10 minute walk to Downtown. Close to Fanuel Hall and Aquarium as well. The train is very accessible and uber is also another option for a cheap ride to Back Bay or North End NEARBY TRANSPORTATION Subway Silver Line – Courthouse Station Red Line – South Station Commuter Rail – South Station Buses 4 – Courthouse Station  (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) – World Trade Centre Station  (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) – South Station Ferries F1 – Rowes Wharf Ferry Terminal F4, F2H – Long Wharf Ferry Terminal

interaction: I am available by phone, email, or Messenger 24/7. Don’t hesitate to contact us if you need anything, from extra towels to restaurant recommendations. Otherwise, we’ll leave you to enjoy your stay.
house_rules: House Rules 1. You're welcome to request an early check in or late checkout and I can confirm in 24 hours. 2. We do not allow smoking; breaking this rule will incur a $1000 fine. Most of our locations do not allow pets. 3. Generally, parties or excessive noise are not allowed in our locations. It may be possible to obtain permission to host a party; contact me to learn more. 4. If a location is left in an exceptionally messy state, we will charge $150 for every extra hour of cleaning required. 5. Guests take full responsibility for any accidents, injuries, or illnesses that occur while on the premises or its facilities. By accepting this reservation, it is agreed that all guests are expressly assuming the risk of any harm arising from their use of the premises. Guests recognize that they may personally purchase insurance to protect themselves in such events. 6. If more guests sleep at a location than the number originally stated in the booking, the security deposit will be charged in f
host_about: Im a Boston native and happy to help you see the great parts of Boston that arent in the Guidebooks. I look forward to connecting with people traveling to Boston and aim to make each guest experience this beautiful place like a local. Thanks for checking out my place and I hope to talk to you soon!

name: Stayloom's Gorgeous Renovation | near Beach
summary: Stayloom is dedicated to giving you a luxurious and authentic travel experience. From the refurbished table to the local artwork, our homes are furnished so every detail has a genuine connection to the surrounding community. Spacious and suitable for groups of all sizes, each Stayloom home is crafted with the intention of bringing family and friends together. Stay in style. Stay for the stories. Stayloom.
space: Spacious, professionally designed, and featuring an upmarket location, this contemporary Stayloom home is a modern homage to the crisp chic and casual comfort of the mid-century modern aesthetic. Loaded with contemporary amenities, this place is the perfect space for large groups, families, and companies coming to town on business who seek first class accommodations in Boston. - Open-concept living area designed for large groups - Chef’s kitchen filled with essential cookware - Central air conditioning and heat, laundry (washer/dryer/iron), and high speed internet - All beds feature Tempurpedic-quality mattresses and silky, high thread count linens. - All bathrooms are immaculate and include essential toiletries and stacks of plush cotton towels.

Loaded with contemporary amenities, this place is the perfect space for large groups, families, and companies coming to town on business who seek first class accommodations in Boston. - Open-concept living area designed for large groups - Chef’s kitchen filled with essential cookware - Central air conditioning and heat, laundry (washer/dryer/iron), and high speed internet - All beds feature T
neighborhood_overview: Located in the heart of Boston’s beloved and storied “Southie” neighborhood, our home is right in the middle of Boston's restaurant and nightlife mecca. It also places you within easy striking distance of downtown. Dig your toes into the sand at the beach (10 minute walk away!). All guests after booking will receive a personalized list of recommendations including locals favorite spots, restaurants, and activities. We will provide detailed information and guides on the surrounding area to enhance your overall experience. Two final notes: Southie is a tight-knit family neighborhood, and while we want all guests to enjoy their time here, we want to also make note of the fact that the neighborhood and our neighbors need to be respected, especially as far as noise is concerned. Additionally, please note that I manage this property for a local homeowner; the owner of this home lives in the building and thus we ask all guests to please respect the home and keep noise to a minimum after dark.
notes: If you have questions you need answered before securing your booking, or you simply want to talk with us first, reach out to our Stayloom team with an inquiry before a reservation request. Please also note that one-night stays on the weekend or reservations that start or end on a Saturday may be subject to an additional fee. Want more options? Check out Stayloom’s other homes located in popular destinations across the nation such as Boston, Savannah, New Orleans, and more! At Stayloom, we make sure you find the perfect fit. Damage deposit: $999 (non-Airbnb reservations only)
transit: Walk 3 minutes to catch the 7 bus which will whisk you to Downtown Boston in about 15 minutes (depending on traffic conditions).  Free street parking is abundant in my neighborhood -- please just pay attention to street cleaning days and resident parking only zones. There are also plenty of BlueBikes (bike shares) in our neighborhood for the bicycle lover!
access: The entire apartment is reserved for your exclusive use. Please note that the back deck and backyard are off-limits as they are under construction.
interaction: You will have complete privacy here, however every question or concern you may have before or during your stay will be promptly addressed via messenger or phone. In the case of a maintenance emergency, our ground team is available to assist you. Entry is keyless; there’s no need to coordinate key pick up.
house_rules: - Please respect Boston's noise ordinance. Quiet hours begin at 11:00pm, weekdays & weekends. Thank you for helping to keep good relations with our neighbors! - Any visit from the police department will result in immediate eviction without refund. - Reservations with a check in OR out on a Saturday, as well as one night reservations in general, may be subject to additional fees.
host_about:
I am a proud member of the Stayloom network! My personal loves include spending time with family, trying new and unfamiliar cuisines, and exploring the world. Part of the joy for me is in providing a platform to let you discover what I love about my favorite cities in America. While I'm a native Bostonian, my wife is a New Yorker, and we spend a good deal of time in Austin, Texas, too. We hope we have the chance to show you New York, Boston, and Austin's amazing energies and vibrant cultures.

Cheers,
David
Stay Heirloom

neighborhood_overview: This furnished rental is located in South Boston, a growing city neighborhood featuring an expansive waterfront playground and a strong diversity of restaurant and bar options.“Southie” as it is known by locals, is one of Boston’s most traditional areas, where everyone is bonded by a strong sense of community. Holidays are celebrated together with large, joyous parades. New restaurants and homes are rapidly rising along the industrial corridor where South Boston meets Seaport. Spend your weekends exploring Castle Island, a popular site of historic fortification, or take a long stroll down William Day Boulevard. As South Station is only 15 minutes away by train and 5 minutes by car, residents have a quick commute to the city center.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
transit: NA
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
house_rules: - Building amenities may have an extra cost - A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled - Same day check-ins are only guaranteed if booking is made before 4 pm - Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions, along with related fees. Guests should notify us of any pets prior to check-in (failing to do so will incur a penalty) - Blueground has the right to enter and inspect the apartment or to show the apartment to a potential tenant any day of the week between 9am and 6pm as long as the tenant has been informed via email at least one day in advance - Please contact us for details

host_about:
Blueground is changing the way the world experiences furnished living.

We take perfectly located apartments and turn them into beautifully-designed and thoughtfully-equipped homes available for stays of 30 days or longer. 

Each Blueground property comes with modern furniture, premium linens, high-speed WiFi, and everything else you need to get up and running from day one.

All backed by our dedicated, on-the-ground support team, Blueground makes finding a new place to call home frictionless. Show up and start living with Blueground today.

Founded in 2013, Blueground is currently present in nine cities around the world and has a portfolio of more than 1500 premium properties... and growing.

summary: Welcome to our condo in South Boston! - NEW listing, freshly painted with high-end appliances and finishes. - Convenient location; Less than a 15 min drive to the Airport, 10 min walk to the trendy Seaport and a 5 min bus drive to South Station and Convention center.  - Tall ceilings and lots of windows with natural light. - Beautiful open concept living area and fully-equipped kitchen. - Amazing views from our roof deck. - Accommodates 3 persons, with queen size bed and sleeper sofa.

neighborhood_overview: Our condo is located a 5 min walk from Broadway, where there are a number of trendy restaurants and bars. The local favorites are: The Broadway, Lincoln, Capo and Loco. For brunch, hit up Paramount which is down the street. For a nice run, Castle Island is a 5 min run away. There is a nice 3.5 mile loop that we like. The new Seaport area is nearby where you can find a number of good restaurants and bars. Our favorite place is Row34, but book well in advance or wait for a bar spot. For drinks, choose among the many new hot spots, such as, Trillium brewery, City Tap and Drink.
notes: Street parking is challenging in South Boston. Weekends are free, but on weekdays parking is Resident only from 6PM to 8AM. Recommend to come with no car, or use SpotHero.
transit: The best option for public transportation is bus line 7 (bus stop: Summer st. @ E 1st St), which brings you to South Station in a few minutes.  Blue bike has a bike share location on Broadway. Logan Airport is less than a 15 min drive away. The Broadway T-station (redline) is 1 mile away.
interaction: Available for questions at all times during the day.
house_rules: NA
host_about: Hi there! My husband and I are so excited to host you at our new, beautiful one bedroom condo in South Boston. We live in the same building and are available should you have any questions or requests.

name: Stayloom's Historic Designer Duplex | near T
summary: Stayloom is dedicated to giving you a luxurious and authentic travel experience. From the refurbished table to the local artwork, our homes are furnished so every detail has a genuine connection to the surrounding community. Spacious and suitable for groups of all sizes, each Stayloom home is crafted with the intention of bringing family and friends together.  Stay in style. Stay for the stories. Stayloom.
space: Located just minutes from Downtown, our Stayloom home was inspired by the warmth and functional comfort of the provincial aesthetic. This listing is for both units of a two-family duplex; you will have free reign over the entire building. Originally constructed in 1880, our home features 2 spacious living areas, 2 kitchens, a fully private back deck and yard, and contemporary amenities, making this is your ultimate travel destination in Boston. - Comfortably accommodates up to 17 guests - Private deck and backyard area stocked with a grill and plenty of seating. - Central location allows for exploration on foot or public transit- no need to rent a car! - Renovated, fully equipped chef’s kitchens feature brand new stainless steel appliances and ample stone surfaces.  - Accessibility: There is one unit on the first floor (5 steps up to unit from street; no stairs in unit once inside). There is also a second unit above it, about a dozen steps up the stairs. Both units have completely priv

neighborhood_overview: Nestled on a quiet residential street in Boston’s beloved “Southie” neighborhood, our home is minutes from downtown, boasts convenient access to public transport, and is within walking distance to shops and a vibrant culinary scene. Whether you are in town on business or looking for some time to unwind, our home’s location is sure to suit your needs. All guests after booking will receive a personalized list of recommendations including locals favorite spots, restaurants, and activities. We will provide detailed information and guides on the surrounding area to enhance your overall experience.
notes: If you have questions you need answered before securing your booking, or you simply want to talk with us first, reach out to our Stayloom team with an inquiry before a reservation request. Please also note that one-night stays on the weekend or reservations that start or end on a Saturday may be subject to an additional fee. Want more options? Check out Stayloom’s other homes located in popular destinations across the nation such as Boston, Savannah, New Orleans, and more! At Stayloom, we make sure you find the perfect fit. Damage deposit: $1199 (non-Airbnb reservations only)
transit: In addition to the #9 bus, there are two red line train stations (Broadway and Andrew) within a 10-15 minute walk of the apartment. Logan airport is a short 15-20 minute drive from the home. While there is on-street parking available, we can also recommend nearby parking garages should you bring a vehicle with you.
access: The entire duplex (2 units) is reserved for your exclusive use.
interaction: You will have complete privacy here, however every question or concern you may have before or during your stay will be promptly addressed via messenger or phone. In the case of a maintenance emergency, our ground team is available to assist you. Entry is keyless; there’s no need to coordinate key pick up.
house_rules: - Please respect Boston's noise ordinance. Quiet hours begin at 11:00pm, weekdays & weekends. Thank you for helping to keep good relations with our neighbors! - Any visit from the Boston police department will result in immediate eviction without refund. - Saturday check ins (in addition to 1 night stays in general) may be subject to additional fees.
host_about:
I am a proud member of the Stayloom network! My personal loves include craft beer, travel, and being a news junkie. Part of the joy for me is in providing a platform to let you discover what I love about this city. I hope I have the chance to show you Boston’s amazing energy and vibrant culture.

Cheers,
David
Stay Heirloom

summary: Peaceful perch with beautiful urban courtyard on historic Thomas Park in the heart of Southie. Think "Rear Window" with more trees & less drama! Restaurants, nightlife & beach a few minutes walk in one direction, city center a half hour walk in the other. 3 min. walk to public transit. Chef's kitchen, g.ooglehome in all rooms, Apple TV in most. Free movies & beach stuff. 2 bikes and airport service available. 2 proper bedrooms, + 3 more rooms to sleep, + 3 baths, WD, fireplace & AC.
space: This is not a cookie-cutter new construction - It's a lovingly restored full house built in eighteen sixty-five. We have been AirBNB-ing the 2 bedrooms separately, and are Superhosts. summary: Located in the heart of South Boston, this 2 bedroom apartment is perfectly located for somone needing quick access to the downtown area.
