name: S. Boston Suite in Historic Home, w/Breakfast
summary: Nolan House is a comfortable Victorian home, convenient to public transportation, the Boston Convention Center & Seaport. While it’s easy to access any of Boston’s neighborhoods, there are also many local establishments to entice you, from just a block away, continuing along Broadway in either direction. We serve a selection of continental breakfast items every morning, but you could also start your day with coffee at Caffé Nero instead, or one of the Irish pubs serving breakfast on the weekend.
space: The Essex is a quiet, well-appointed suite, located on the third floor of an older Victorian home, where you will have a private bathroom off the hallway. It boasts an extremely comfortable full-size bed, with two additional twin beds situated in an adjoining alcove, providing  a convenient option for friends traveling together, or families with older children.
description: Nolan House is a comfortable Victorian home, convenient to public transportation, the Boston Convention Center & Seaport. While it’s easy to access any of Boston’s neighborhoods, there are also many local establishments to entice you, from just a block away, continuing along Broadway in either direction. We serve a selection of continental breakfast items every morning, but you could also start your day with coffee at Caffé Nero instead, or one of the Irish pubs serving breakfast on the weekend. The Essex is a quiet, well-appointed suite, located on the third floor of an older Victorian home, where you will have a private bathroom off the hallway. It boasts an extremely comfortable full-size bed, with two additional twin beds situated in an adjoining alcove, providing  a convenient option for friends traveling together, or families with older children. Nolan House is a private home, with owners John & Kathy in residence. They welcome you downstairs into the dining room every morning fo
neighborhood_overview: Many cafés and restaurants are a short block away on Broadway, as well as pubs, bars, and other colorful watering holes. John is happy to offer suggestions based on what you’re in the mood for. We are a short bus ride to the beach and Castle Island, and Dorchester Heights is a few blocks uphill for views of the city and access to a revolutionary historic site.
notes: NA
transit: South Boston is an ultra convenient location to explore all of Boston from. Nolan House itself is located right on three major bus routes, which will take you directly to destinations like the South End and Copley Square, while stopping at Broadway Station, on the red line, if you want to hop on to the T. You can certainly walk to the T station if you’d rather. Boston is eminently walkable, and ride share services like Lyft and Uber are always available, and a taxi station is a short block away on Broadway. The Boston Convention Center is also within walking distance, as is Boston’s Seaport, which will get you to the Tea Party ship/museum, and well as the beginning of the emerald necklace parkway, a lovely way to walk and see the city and historic sites like Faneuil Hall and on to the North End, with the Old North Church and Paul Revere’s House. Again, John is available to advise you on routes and how best to get around. On street parking is technically available, but parking anywhere
interaction: Nolan House is a private home, with owners John & Kathy in residence. They welcome you downstairs into the dining room every morning for a complimentary continental breakfast between the hours of 8:30 to 10:00 am. Outside of breakfast hours, we have provided a small refrigerator in the room to keep any beverages and snacks.
house_rules: Please note: we are absolutely unable to accommodate children younger than 8 years old under any circumstances. Price assumes up to two adults per night. Additional guests require you to message us first. There will be an additional $50 charge per adult, per night added, up to four people total. If the additional guests are children between the ages of 8 and 12 years old, the additional charge will be $25 per child, per night. We request you message us before booking stays longer than a week.

host_about:
We have fallen in love with New England - we love the history and the variety of things to do and see.

My wife and I are originally from the West so being able to drive one hour and see Plymouth Rock, or Providence, RI has totally changed us.  We love to spend weekends exploring and adventuring with our kids.  We just returned from our biggest family trip yet - Singapore, Thailand, Cambodia, South Korea, and Vietnam for 3.5 months - it was amazing.

We would love to have you stay at our place!
